5JlS2RAvCrpFkH-h0vAVkQ.text: I've visited several times - the coffee and pastries are fine.  My issue is with the staff.  I normally pay in cash - but twice now I've had to request my change back.  I usually tip - but the decision to tip is mine - not the staff's'.  I shouldn't have to request my change back.

SUZvVbB0Sm4DaxENqtMRkw.text: Great location in old town.  Not the most warm welcome, but the coffee was fabulous!  Had the cappucinno and sister had tea.  Tea had the loose leaves.

BJROi9okkegGqkY5Cutitg.text: Great coffee, they take their time making it right. And its not a long wait at all. Was there with my folks over the holidays and they enjoyed it very much. Also ran into Downtown Dan always a welcome sight.

14F7IuA5yRQNy_q7tkBh6g.text: Great little coffee spot in downtown Scottsdale.  Cappucinos here are the best in the Valley - reminds me of being in Italy.  Great scones and muffins too and a relaxing place to get some work done.

O0PMUtCh-5X5BVwq2arucA.text: Awesome coffee.... they brew each cup fresh. Cute little spot in the heart of oldtown. The Las Vegas coffee was amazing. Nice and strong! The Baristas are super friendly. Good vibe.

3yqwCpYpzKCRpjs_xQpNlQ.text: I absolutely love their lattes. It's unfortunate that their locations aren't convenient for my normal commute or else I would be in everyday. However, that doesn't stop me from leaving an extra 30 minutes early (and being a few minutes late) if I'm craving some Cartel. It's definitely not a quick stop though. Be prepared to wait about 10-20 min to get your drink....it's worth it!

4MZz7cxhI59tZmJmt2sKlw.text: Cartel has an amazing atmosphere and their drinks are amazing - I am only sad that they don't have honey any more!

lmUG8wD0HpxOdyD1aESLqg.text: Gotta love the vibe at Cartel. Before I even get to the coffee, the place itself deserves recognition. Local art, some for sale, covers the walls and is always changing. The music is always spot on, the couches are comfy, and when you leave your clothes smell like a nice dark roast for the rest of the day (I suppose some may not like this but I rather enjoy it).   As for the coffee, prepare to get your buzz on. I always get a hell of a pick me up from my go to Cartel Americano. Exceptional flavor, fresh, and just as good iced as it is hot, they rarely disappoint. My only complaint is the cost, but considering their support of local art and business, I can deal with the additional charge.

WWfqLt2ZWkMj_NejECVIxg.text: Oh how I will miss this coffee when I go home to California.  Always a perfect latte in taste, temperature and texture.

_kKgR89FE4j9dDXFyHtGNw.text: I'll be honest.  I was hesitant to try this place after reading the mixed reviews on Yelp, but the nice girl at Tea Time down the street told me I should try it so I did.  The service has been very good, they take your plastic via Square which I love, and my hot green tea was very good served in a heavy glass tumbler (not the norm for sure).  The wifi connection is good/fast.  The music is a little heavy, but if you want a place to  unwind, you could do that here.  Not an uppity pretentious Scottsdale norm for sure.  I will come back if I have the chance.

nwqHXMKEJx5lksnrtnAkMQ.text: It's a Cartel Coffee alright. Mmmmyep. Drinks can vary in consistency depending on who the barista is, (sometimes my mochas have a little too much milk in them, but not by a lot - other days they don't maybe) but such is life I suppose; a bit on the pricey side, but you get a quality cup. They've recently started to foray into teas and the Oolong they served on one occasion was one of the best cups of tea I've had in a while... Though on another day, they served the same Oolong in a pint glass at far too hot of a temperature.. I let that slide though. In the shop they feature local art; last month ago or so they were lithographs of an E100 Corolla and a Previa, two of the most passionless yet innovative examples of Japanese auto engineering in the 1990's... Though that exhibit was actually about the artist's dad. At any rate, this month(?) they're featuring some local furniture pieces and Heavy Pedal track bicycles. It truly is a very eclectic display sometimes. Today, the cream pattern in my mocha looked like a dong.  Parking can be a bit difficult as it is on 5th ave with all the Indian jewelry, souvenir and what-have-you shops, so getting a cup in around lunchtime can be a bit difficult if you're a motorist. Interestingly enough, the pavement on 5th ave is pretty friendly for skateboards (as in, actual skateboards; though cruisers/longboards can absorb the pavement just fine), so provided cars watch out for you (which is unlikely in the wintertime due to snowbirds in addition to the typical elderly folk), it's a pleasant time to just skate on over.

r4fzCHYJnx5xuEYZknWvbw.text: Coffee, beer, and food.....everything a girl could ask for!  The lattes are very tasty and is perfectly paired with the Big Ben sandwich.  This breakfast sandwich is a whopper with the right amount of chiplote aioli.  There's plenty of seats in this hip little coffee shop.  Whether you're stopping in for some coffee or there to borrow the wifi, this is a great local place!  I will definitely have to stop in for their daily Happy Hour and check out their drink selections.

5FwLybkKhEt_L1KSmTe5Pg.text: I'm torn. The coffee is probably the best I've had anywhere in Phoenix, but the service is possibly the worst I've had anywhere. The dudes are nice, but must be lacking any previous cafe experience. The place is super busy on a Saturday morning, but due mainly to the exceptionally slow service. Lets do some numbers. We walked in at 10am, waited in line until twenty past, and still didn't have a coffee in our hands by 11. Then after much fumbling and confusion, they lost our order twice before informing us that the grinder was broken. We went down the road and had a great coffee from the ice cream shop in no less than five minutes. Perhaps this place really is a lab fronting as a cafe.

u57dnvU8iyVwRtUMCHY0-w.text: They're a bit spendy compared to your average coffee joint, but you're definitely paying for the quality. Best cup of coffee I've had in the Phoenix Metro Area.

kHobrR233gKqp7gPaWCZpw.text: a fave. phenomenal coffee... stellar atmosphere.

X5VDoe1ilVd1Nh9F8n4nqA.text: Really slow service and the Americano and latte we ended up with were terrible. I was able to add syrup to my latte to cover up the taste and the fact that the vanilla was left out. The Americano couldn't be saved because the beans were burned. I would not recommend this place. It's an overhyped, overrated hipster coffee joint with bad coffee.

wN1Y1bPFQjLkCIzKPeKHhA.text: This place is awesome.  I don't like coffee very much, but I LOVED their mocha.  When we arrived there was a piano player and a guitar player jamming out, plus there was great outdoor seating if you wanted to get away from that.  It was so much fun.

D00XSiqi37dhnTyEFjpcCA.text: I also look for a good independent coffee shop. This one was very good, wonderful soy cortado. Will definitely come back here when in the area!

b1V5U1hGswWRkjOPKZXQ-g.text: A great escape, small but filled with culture and ambiance. The place reminds me of being back home in NYC. Theres a hipster vibe and cool talking pieces around the place. The coffee tastes like dirt but we go for the environment. Great place to kill time, read, relax and occasionally catch some live music.

LivDwlhyB06T4ZiyUEQLpg.text: Seriously killer hot chai latte.  The blueberry muffin I had to go with it didn't hurt my feelings either.  Several outlets available to plug in your electronic gizmos.    Would definitely make a repeat visit next time I'm in Scottsdale.

dODh0jetVGVtuACIX-uIgw.text: Very friendly coffee staff! It's not my favorite latte in town, but it is one of my favorite plain iced coffees! They also serve the iced coffee at Phoenix Public Market Cafe. If you like iced coffee, this is your go-to in Old Town!   I thought it was a nice touch that they serve wine and beer. I'm the first one to admit that's how I get through 50% of my extensive school work/research. Ha! Now I don't have to go somewhere and be that person on their laptop and 10 books at the dinner table.

_Kudq2_UaggP32KaeJmQ1A.text: The best tasting decaf coffee that I have ever had! We bought a bag to go home to NYC with! Worth the trip if you are local or if you are an out of towner like me, they have an online shop to purchase from.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon Dijon Pretzel!

UqlVuhPBJv2uXZk5HqG7cw.text: Always passed by this place so today, I finally tried it. The place looks nice and would be a great spot to hang out. The price range is decent. I ordered a vanilla latte and I really enjoyed it! I loved that it isn't too much milk like most lattes are. This place is a good alternative for the typical Starbucks cup. Wish we lived closer!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte

izpjOnTxBAy5IC35waV3KA.text: 5/3/12 V. and I walked over here after a cool happy hour elsewhere, and this time I brought my beautiful cousin with us. V and I ordered cappuccino (Cartel was out of V's favorite chai), while my cuzzo ordered an 8 oz. latte with honey. I also spied a chocolate layer cake, and what? It's half price during happy hour, you don't say? Well, I'll have a slice then! My cup arrived first, and it was a beauty, so cameras came out. Soon after, V's and cuzzo's beverages and the cake arrived. yelp.com/biz_photos/fa1G... yelp.com/biz_photos/fa1G... I offered first bites- V declined and cousin dug in, but only to find that it was "a bit dry." I concurred, but I figured I could just chase the bites down with sips of my delicious cappuccino. V enjoyed hers, even though she forgot to have them add sugar. (No biggie... she was able to add later.) Cousin could hardly taste the honey in her latte, so she visited the sugar station. She eventually had to abandon her drink when it became too sweet to finish-- all the honey she couldn't taste apparently had settled on the bottom. I'm thinking this is going to be a tradition of mine when HH'ing in OTS. :) yelp.com/biz_photos/fa1G...

Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A slice of chocolate cake and a cappuccino.

FE-wtsfPrPmpnHn1IPnbYQ.text: Love this place! And the coffee and tea are awesome. The staff is cool and always cheerful. Great place to get some work in while having a great cup of coffee or some delicious pastries. Definitely will be back numerous times.

en_LX_nxwK_I3IQX9dypNQ.text: Amazing Coffee Spot!!!  I am very picky about coffee and I strictly search for single origin beans. I only prefer to drink Single Origin, and this place only serves single origin beans so it literally felt like I was at home. This place also only serves single origin coffee directly from the specific farms the beans come from!  This means you are getting fresh, whole bean coffee that does not have any other negative influences on it. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone and everyone who enjoys a delicious cup of coffee. Whether you're new to coffee or an experienced drinker.  They also have amazing varieties of how they Brew your coffee and the prices are not bad either!!  The service was great as well. They were extremely helpful and even educational when it came to explaining what Cartel was all about.  Great place!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing Single Origin Ethiopian Coffee!

DmM4oWozHRiLy9zbgAoWyw.text: This is the first decent coffee I have had in Arizona. In London, we take our coffee very seriously and I was so pleased when I discovered this wonderful gem! You can choose a variety of beans, mainly south american and Mexican (no African beans when I went). They have the regular latte, cappuccino etc but for those looking for a real treat, they have areopress, v60, clever, and chemex! I had an areopress which was almost perfect. Their baked goods are also lovely, mainly the scones and banana bread. This is a proper coffee place so you won't find silly caramel sweet sugary coffee or other nonsense...

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Serving areopress, v60, clever, and chemex!

1epbYFOvsZ5zA99eOKieeg.text: I stopped in for a cappuccino and was pretty disappointed.  There were five people sitting in the cafe, and only one order in front of mine, and it took a long time for my drink. It was  lukewarm, and served in a miniscule cup.  And not particularly distinctive in any way, though it looked like the barrista tried to create a cutesy design with the foam.  I'd really just prefer good, hot cappuccino in a reasonable amount of time.

pzLVUD2djfQHVu56cR01aw.text: This place is super cool. Loved the tree stump stools, the unfinished tables with hardware and chalk menu board. The staff is very nice and the java is pretty darn good. I went for iced latte but I couldn't resist the the chocolate chip cookie with BACON! Yes...bacon! Why does bacon make everything taste better?!   Can't wait to check out their wine selection next!

10GF0i1VmdCZHax5SQknLg.text: Great tea (hot/iced), great hot cocoa, and my friends tell me the coffee is tasty, too.  It has that great Cartel vibe - modern, funky, artsy, classy - and friendly staff.  Lots of seating (mostly tables and chairs, but some backless couches line the sides), plus a cozy, dog-friendly side patio.  The drink menu is simple - lots of coffees but not a huge selection of weird ways to have them (no almond milk, but they do have soy).  A few teas, hot cocoa (yay!), and they are now serving beer as well (pretty tasty stuff).  It's been quiet on my visits, which is lovely for reading, and the music is soft but awesome.  I haven't tried the food beyond the cookies (which are decent in a pinch but too dry to be scrumptious to this dessert snob).

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute coffee shop, simple offerings, friendly service.

Tw4UzBSAjIyiJ2kSXZgzrQ.text: Coffee shop adventures #3  Traveled to AZ and found this awesome spot ! Must try the iced chai tea and agave nectar !! James is great "when in Rome ... Whatever that means"

mSpQ47odqp8rhecSdg3EFQ.text: I've been frequenting this location for a while, having wanted to explore more coffee options than just Starbucks and I had heard this place mentioned more than a few times. Stepping in the atmosphere is entirely different and welcoming. With a nice modern industrial design and a clean lobby. The coffee and espresso drinks are top notch and where before I could only take coffee with plenty of sugar and cream now with them I don't need any of that. They've opened my tastebuds up to how good coffee can actually be. So if you're reading this and want to expand your tastes away from quick cheap coffee give Cartel a try, you won't be disappointed.

tqhWvlWwJtWRdoClErH8lQ.text: The best chai you'll ever have. The drinks are always great and the staff is friendly. Only four stars because I dirty chai will run you 8 bucks and sometimes you wait upwards of 10 Minutes for your drink. I keep going back because this place make quality coffee drinks

-ljOFlQ3YR7zLyzVTK7rdw.text: Service is stale and unwelcoming (tried this place twice).   They didn't have half & half or creamer available, only milk. That was a surprise! The small, or tiny sized, cup was full of ice and barely any coffee.   The only sweetener sitting out was Splenda, no stevia. After stepping away, I did overhear they have simple syrup (which was not sitting out).  A/C must be rationed by the owners because it was extremely warm inside. Not a pleasurable experience.

fo36sjqMg7TUI6IyNdXM-g.text: Love the coffee and the atmosphere! I get everything from my 4 shot latte to my whole beans for more morning coffee there its a great place!

HWbIJ-LczHRZu_3JIEsJOw.text: Really knowledgable here. Makes  coffee an experience rather than a product being sold. I had the Chemex, guy took pride in everything he was doing.

tLEZV_3tsMygx3Tf_YQ46w.text: Yummy coffee! The baked goods are to die for. Some of the tables are not the best for studying though.

i1Z2ycgfbSw9RWMBMgbgWg.text: The best coffee Arizona has to offer!  Cartel Coffee Lab does it all. They send their roaster down to South/Central America to source great coffee, they roast coffee themselves in Tempe, AZ and they brew the coffee in a way that respects the chemistry of the bean and ensures the resulting cup is of the highest quality. Other AZ cafes come close, often offering great cups of coffee, but none are as involved in the process from farm to cup as Cartel is! Trust me, you, the customer, are the beneficiary of all their crazy coffee worship.  Cartel also has several cafes that all have their own unique personality. This 5th Ave location in Old Town is one of the friendliest, most welcoming and relaxing of their cafes. Great place to get work done and the baristas seem to cater to the crowd in setting the ambiance. If everyone's in with friends getting (alcoholic) beverages then the music will be turned up a bit and more upbeat, if everyone's got their laptops out or their nose buried in a book the music will be a bit more calm.   My favorite drinks are any of their hand-brewed coffees, the cappuccino, the cortado and the one-and-one (ask your barista!).  Oh, and I could rant for an hour about why complaints about price are irrational but i'll keep it short. Coffee is an agricultural product that requires an ENORMOUS amount of work to grow and process. If you take a second to think about where your coffee comes from and all the hands that work to bring it to you, you'll wonder why each cup doesn't cost $10 and each bag doesn't cost $50!

DRfqeWTvEa0NsaBwDMoU2Q.text: I was so excited to finally find a place that served quality iced Toddy coffee in Arizona. This place has a great vibe, and great coffee products. It's a smaller location than the original in Tempe, but still a great place to meet, get some work done, or just hangout.  Iced coffee is a must in the hot Arizona heat, so if you haven't had iced Toddy coffee before then you MUST go here and get some.

gbEkl8_28AGw79jw3EYPmA.text: This is my favorite cold brew iced coffee around. I'm not a coffee expert but based on the Cold Brew that I have had around Scottsdale, this wins. I get my 64 oz jug filled up every Sunday and it lasts me the week. Staff is nice as well.

6Q975sxVQlrgJpSitVahyg.text: Great imports of coffee, freshly roasted. Very alternative but lively atmosphere. A bit on the pricy side but can't really complain.

koXUjrVnn_Qkajtc6ksjmw.text: awesome.  Small, local spot -just what we look for when we travel.  After living in the Northwest (Seattle area) for a long while we've grown accustomed to outstanding coffee (NOT starbucks) and this place was great.  Atmosphere was really unique and laid back as well with semi-outdoor seating.  I also noticed they have a small but legit beer selection.  When I was there they had on tap Odell Mercenary IPA, Firestone Velvet Merlin, and a few others.  Whoever orders their beers obviously knows what good beer is.  We didn't end up getting any but a good sign nonetheless.  Service was good and they were friendly.  We ended up buying a mug because they are pretty cool too.  Overall, superb place to stop in and have a leisurely coffee.  Definitely going back next time we are in the Dale

rgnKKys61w08chgOHtSLkQ.text: I have generally loved Cartel since I've been in Phoenix, but was saddened this time after not going for over a year. I took some guests there, thinking I'd treat them to my favorite coffee place in the Phoenix area. The coffees were lukewarm and didn't have much flavor, and in smaller cups than I remember (paper cups, even if you're staying in- except the cappuccino of course, also lukewarm).  I remember HOT coffee and coffee so strong and delicious that it gave me a buzz.  What happened??

a9NNJS4ufduxCvEDw4KL3Q.text: Worst. Coffee. Experience. Ever...  sorry guys... bad coffee and music was so loud I couldn't work/hear/concentrate. Way pricey for tiny cup. Portland or isn't even that $$

XBDqu9u2GiFm42VH39Qjuw.text: Neat little place. Coffee was okay. I asked for soy milk but got whole milk Instead (lactose intolerant). I did not like the coffee here, tasted like any other low quality coffee shop. Iam a coffee lover and enjoy nice fresh espresso beans, this isn't the place for me. 7hJfCsF8nHeu573ujQeBQg.text: Great coffee options here, brewed to order.  Nice staff.  Hipster vibe and customer base though, which is entertaining to me.  Parking is good on weekdays.  A few draft beers available, so this is a great night hangout also.

sha3W_dk4y31K2ZJCnjqPQ.text: I visited from NYC and were told by so many the coffee was amazing. The environment is definitely cool for the area and mimics a lot of bigger city trendy coffee / hang out places. But a bummer on the coffee. Just not as flavorful as it could have been and as if they almost didnt pull a full shot. I think if they nail the coffee, it would stand up to any coffee place in any major city.

I have only been a few times because parking in old town scottsdale can be annoying, but will definitely try to make more of an effort to get more espresso from here! 04Nd6EuNxgzo4Xv58wdXUQ.text: My friend got a cold pressed coffee. Good flavor but no almond milk offered? Just soy and cows milk. I find that odd. Also, no stevia or raw sugar. Probably would never go back

8OAylPhO1B7GUt5B3NUTew.text: Best coffee around, in my opinion.  I've had friends that have worked for Cartel and they have nothing but good things to say about the company.  Highly recommended!

VphJ9dbdFEEdmBBm9MPDfA.text: Cartel Coffee Lab has the three C's...coffee, cocktails (well beer but that doesn't start with a c) and cuisine. So with the three C's, I say, welcome to Scottsdale Cartel!   Although I frequented this location's former coffee shop many times during its existence, I had yet to visit the new Cartel Coffee Lab when it opened...until today. I realize what I've been missing and I won't make that mistake again. The location was cool before, but now with the Cartel touch, it's even cooler. The coffee is the delicious Cartel coffee blend and the vibe is eclectic and coffee shop'esque. But here's a nice twist courtesy of Cartel's elves. Besides basic baked goods, they also serve a simple breakfast and lunch menu.   The breakfast menu includes items such as breakfast sandwiches and oatmeal. The lunch menu includes items such as a turkey sandwich with a delicious pesto sauce, a ham sandwich and salads like tuna salad. It's a small menu but it's good. Plus you get chips, a salad or fruit with your lunch sandwich. Add a non-fat vanilla latte and you've got yourself a delicious lunch, or at least I did!   Seating is slightly limited but you should be able to find a seat on a basic work day. Plus, the vibe is comfortable and perfect to sit and work (as long as you're ok with community tables).

GJK-XMe6Red7PMst0oNhWg.text: This is one of my favorite coffee spots.  They make one of the best vanilla lattes I've ever had.  The new cold brew floats look out of this world.  If there's a negative about this place, it's that it's not a place to go when you're in a hurry.  The staff are perfectionists about their craft, sometimes to the detriment of timely and/or friendly service.

vrwVdqM7v7DwMxoKrApCnQ.text: If you're looking for a  good strong cup of coffee - we had a cafe au lait and a cortado with half and half. Super location and nice relaxing vibe - great area and nice small shops/galleries. They have lots of different seating areas inside and outside - loved the decor!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great cortado made with half &amp; half and a cappuccino - I&#39;m in heaven!   If you want a great tasting coffee , this place is it!

78y6j7mSXlKHWQI3LodI4g.text: Coffee was average, nothing special, especially for the price. It's in a "happening" part of town and seemed to be a popular place for people to study. Overall, though, would have liked something a bit tastier and impressive for the price.

They also have good looking pastries too if you need a quick bite! Very reasonable prices, friendly staff, and PLENTY of seating! LtDdk5wJP4VZE7WojI3Itg.text: Great vibe! I love coming here to work and the Wifi is amazing seating can be a little tricky if you need back support..but still great vibe and friendly people!

hTYs_d5pvZkrN3-s93URkA.text: I came to leave a raving review, but I'm now seeing that they have a happy hour?! This is something that I wasn't aware of (how embarrassing). I've been hitting up Cartel for the past few years, and I can honestly say I have not, and do not plan on buying beans from anywhere else. Their coffee is just solid amazing quality. I don't live in Old Town anymore, and if I ever wander down there, it's either to see friends or to buy more coffee beans from Cartel. I have tried a few of their pastries in the past as well, but I always get an iced latte and a bacon pretzel when I come. Bits of bacon jammed into a pretzel...what could be better?!  I've always found the service to be fast and extremely friendly, but parking can be a little tricky. There's lots of street parking, and a garage nearby, but in Old Town, that doesn't really mean much since it's always packed. Love this place though!

YTNJfz0oPxkgsuKOkktJyg.text: Great vibe.  Coffee is pretty good too.  I look forward to going back there next time I'm in Scottsdale.

ya9QYURxkjQHbts3i7Kl0w.text: Great atmosphere and a cool location.  The coffee I selected wasn't my favorite, but I appreciated the knowledge and care that went into preparing it and talking about it (recognizing that tastes can vary).  Would definitely recommend dropping by if, like us, you were in the neighborhood and desperate for some coffee not made by Starbucks or your random hotel lobby.

V2luMi-nGW9LzyUvkTSIAA.text: Affordable.  The best quality is the variety of seating. I've never been to a coffee shop with such a variety of seating.   Quiet place to study in the back.   Two more boisterous places to work and have tasty coffee in the front of the store and in a cool outdoor hallway.   Plays cool music.

nWkV9YZ9aMnVi60ZR5qfug.text: What a delicious place in Scottsdale. After a long night out and about, a cold brew is something that one could use to wake up!   COFFEE: I have grown to love cold brew more and more so I got a small here. No cream or sugar for me, but the coffee does not need any of that. This black cold brew is very smooth!   Overall, I was a fan of this "Coffee Lab" and highly recommend it to people visiting or living in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small brew ($2.50)

kko7iv18Sum9Yge-1Ncg6Q.text: Prices high, coffee has a funny peculiar flavor, music hard rock, industrial, gothic weird stuff giving me a headache.  One star.

bJXpUmgsQSzztduPN0ZuOw.text: Great coffee and atmosphere. Lots of seating but SO much plastic. Even when you order your drink to stay you get it in plastic or paper

-J2FjUtMCCgu0cmp0Oyflw.text: Coffee good. Good atmosphere. Why is it that they ask you to tip for takeaway coffee..what happened to tips being for sit down service?

0zTeHBNbrQxm4bpx13KJDg.text: All very good here. No honey but they have agave syrup which works great. 6 shot Americano was just right. Nice setting and seating in Old Town. I'll be back.

OlIGqIlgHhR_P8CA__jmuw.text: Located in Old Town on a street with unique stores. The "lab" was trendy and had a hipster feel. The guy with the samurai man-bun took my order and did a phenomenal job explaining to me all the fancy coffee on their menu. I ended up with the simple mocha which came with an awesome latte art. The taste was not all that exceptional and it didn't give me an energy surge like my usual black coffee. I'll have to go back and try some of their other more unique options under "filter" and espresso. Overall, it was a good alternative if you don't want boring ol' Starbucks. It can be a little pricey, $5 ish for a large mocha.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mocha

ElQZB4eoyeHACDVqQoiC9g.text: Cartel has my favorite coffee in the valley. The coffee is a little on the bitter side but extremely tasty. It's located in the heart of old town Scottsdale. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Really cool vibe.

e05cgFa0Jm5J3wRbfYAdIg.text: The chai I had was too sweet and gross, and way too expensive. I've had drinks from other Cartels before that were coffees that I swear were better. We got our drinks to-go, so this is the experience I have to go off of. My boyfriend's mocha was pretty good from the sip I had of it.

wDI2597EbmBmh6sq7fGzkQ.text: We came here for breakfast and coffee before our hike to Sedona.  The coffee here is EXCELLENT. Smooth and so, so good.  I had the chocolate peanut scone and my friend had the strawberry pop-tart. Both were fantastic!   Love the laid back vibe here. There was plenty of seating and I appreciated the attention to detail in their decor.   Overall, solid place for a quick coffee or to hang out with friends. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry poptart &amp; scone!

a5ZfwlUegUwKqlLnxLmLiQ.text: One of the hippest coffee spots around.... Old Scottsdale.  This is the place to be for strong delicious coffee!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We&#39;re twinning it!!
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loving the upside down ups!!! Large please....
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tis the season!!!

LM4cXhcCPV5U1bRATuoBNw.text: After reading some of the reviews, I realized the poor/rude attitudes is a staple with this place.  Walked in, was not greeted at all.  I just got a look like, "are you gonna order?"  Seriously, you are just a coffee barista!! Don't act like you have earned your PhD to work there.....MMMk?...so i ordered two different coffees.  You'd think that the person making the coffee would specify the difference between the two coffees.  What has happened to common sense?....He set them on the counter with no lids and ran off!......I had never been there before, I didn't know the lids were to the side as well as the liquid sweetener and for a "hip, trendy" place, you serve Splenda!?!  Didn't even get a "thanks, have a nice day"....and they have the nerve to ask for a tip... LOL, ya ok.   I think establishments forget that tips are earned NOT expected.  TIP=GOOD to exceptional service.  Plus - the coffee is not great, will NOT ever return!

wVGBFz5ljIX3lWYgtgrWjQ.text: Nice little place with a perfect setup for all the Apple lovers out there. Coffee really nice but I think one should try the different blends of regular coffee and not the espresso as this is not the niche for Cartel. Nice place and worth a short stop when in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Espresso...

k9hqw9d76bop_9smRu8ldA.text: I've been in twice and ordered the same thing each time, a vanilla latte. The first visit was better as it seemed the Barista really knew what he was doing. I loved that he poured my drink in a tall glass, a real one, and topped it off with an artistic design. The only complaint was that it tasted lukewarm to warm and not near hot. The second visit the Barista made it twice (I think he may have been new), put it in a to go cup instead of a glass, and once again it was lukewarm and unfortunately was not a good taste.   Pros- great location off the main strip away from the tourists. Good atmosphere with nice music, good seating, wifi, etc. Awesome hours of operation- most of the area shuts down at 5 on a Sunday night but this place goes through 9. Thus my reasons for giving it four stars, I mean come on- until 9 on a Sunday!  Cons- latte's are not super hot, more on the warm side and pastries look better than they taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enjoying a vanilla latte on a Sunday night

4WpLYfMgAvLsRpIbq6weKA.text: Neat little place with a small business feel. I don't do coffee so I just stick to the green tea. Nothing special about it. The service is nice. With some of the tea, they encourage you to leave the leaves in, though that leads to a bitter taste from my experience. Meh. No real complaints.

WKZhEErKM3EoE_K96kYvmQ.text: I am a fan of Cartel and what they have done in other locations, but the Old Town location just doesn't do the same for me.  It's so cold and stoic...no personality...and just blah.    Old Town surprisingly doesn't have a lot of "cool" coffee shops like Downtown or even Tempe, so this will have to do when in the area....but it could be so much better.

2bn57yaTg6pEQyoAV9PcTQ.text: High quality coffee and friendly/helpful/hipster staff, but soo overpriced. Barrier to entry is high, and for that reason, you lose a star. Sorry, Cartel, but be more affordable to the average folk.

K9S7jx674YDO8iv15RQDLg.text: I have only been here once so you can take my review or leave it but first impressions do matter. I was looking for a coffee shop alternative that wasn't a big chain like coffee bean so I researched this place and watched their video on their website that made this place sound good. Aye, am I so gullible or what? Of course the video on the business' website is going to make their own business sound good.  Anyway, walked into Cartel and immediately was thrown by the hipsters sitting around chatting by the front door window as they were the mannequins to advertise the store. I hoped there would be no hipsters but that's exactly what I found at this place.  I ordered a green tea for $3.75. Eh.  The guy at the counter starting babbling about tea infusions and such that I really didn't care about. I once paid $4.25 for a tea but I at least understood why because they bagged their own tea. Now this one was just as expensive but it was just tea leaves and water, not even hand bagged or anything. I'm not completely poor so I didn't care as much about the price, but what really got me was that the ambience was so poor that I had to leave with my $3.75 tea since I just could not work in this place.   I had planned to do some creative work on my lap top and I wanted my own little space, even a small table to myself would have been fine, but no. They have bean bag-like cushion chairs on the sides with a low table that in no way resembles a desk and the only other seating is basically long benches you have to share with others. No personal space. I could see this place being really great for collaborative meetings or even social interactions, but that's not what I was looking for today.  I was looking for a cute, little non-chain coffee shop, not too loud, where I could work on a creative project. Didn't find that in here. The energy was just a little weird, from the seating to the staff, I just couldn't spend another minute. I got my tea to go and left and was pissed that I even bought the tea in the first place because I could have spent $3.75 in another place with better ambience.  But after letting the tea steep, it was decently flavored. It's not much to making tea though. Like I said earlier, take it or leave it. But I'll never go back in here again.

HvCtLb_W08jMvfqtD-4uTA.text: I don't have a single complaint about this coffee shop! The cold brew coffee is fantastic, the employees are amazing, and the location is in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale!  I grab a cold brew coffee almost every day before work, which is reasonably priced.  I do, occasionally, have to park down the street, but the it is definitely worth the walk!  I have bought beans from them to brew on the weekends, which is almost just as good as when they make it.

QQu844uwhzojBNW4AniBtA.text: Obsessed with their chai latte. It's the bomb. The ambiance is fantastic. You can sit for a while, work on your laptop with their complimentary wifi. The only down side is if they are busy they get a little backed up. But their products are worth the wait!!

Au9tWkSu-RfnSjVgmETd3Q.text: I met a friend at Cartel in Scottsdale yesterday. It is smaller than the other two locations, but comfortable. The coffee is the same, good, not my favorite in town, but good. The girl who was working yesterday was awesome, very friendly and we had a nice conversation. The decor has a similar vibe to the downtown location, modern....not as 'cool' as the Tempe location, but nice with a lot of community style tables. I would definitely recommend this shop over some of the other Scottsdale options!

jm3LZ_PV_Knra9BapGuT6A.text: Coffee is strong yet pure coffee joint. They make individual espresso by coffee press ( so like a lab )  Their employees Kaylie and Mark are awesome staff members. Excellent service by them. I liked their service. 4 star for service and coffee . Loved the service. Very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside patio
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I didn&#39;t like espresso they offered cappuccino on the same price.

dsBTpXgbf6IvXSYl_DfGCA.text: Excellent atmosphere for a cup of coffee and light conversation or to get some work done. They have a seating area for about 30 inside and another area between their suite and another for about 15 or so people.  This is a spin off from their Tempe location that keeps expanding and is a huge hit by the campus.

AJi4zMenEMYa8IiRIQYo3g.text: My favorite coffee shop in AZ, wish they would come out to Dallas!!! They've grown a lot in their locations and I even found them in the Airport! They have the best iced chai and iced coffee around. Everything is done to perfection to provide only the best coffee experience. As a proclaimed coffee expert, this is where my love for the "real deal" began- at their Tempe location about 5yrs ago :)

Bd6-E1WF0yPLu3UQ057SCA.text: This place is awesome! Their cold brew coffee was on point. I've only been here in the mornings and I really enjoy the ambiance. The staff is super friendly and they have lots of choices to get your day started off on the right foot.

_r8O2Y1JY1A5tsHCWSOsMw.text: Had a wonderful experience at Cartel. Great pour over and gluten free muffin. I like the fact that they give you a number of different brewing option to choose from. Staff was friendly and informative.

VvR-i-EXSQ19S80_JsUpiw.text: The coffee was good although they had cold brew in a warm container. The lemon pound cake was a tad stale, but again, edible. The service was fine but not inspired.  Are you getting the pattern? Maybe it was because it was near noon when we stopped in before taking in a movie but with all the great coffee places, Cartel's initial success might be getting the better of them.

w3B3acI8Pa80kUAAZV39DA.text: They're a swanky little spot in Old Town.  I can see that, because there's so many people.  I just don't understand why..  The set up is pretty cool.  Kinda cozy, kinda industrial.  A little darker than I like, especially where the pastries are since you can barely see them..  Which is why I asked the guy what they were and turned out they were actually 3 items spread out over 6 display risers.  A little sign or something to hint at what these items were would definitely help the ordering process.  Especially if the worker missed the delivery and had no idea what was in them..    So we order 2 black coffees and turns out they didn't have enough to fill the tiny tiny cups for both so they say it'll take a few minutes while they brew it I guess manually?  They have the Aeropress (which is what we use at home), and various sized drip contraptions which I'm assuming they went with to make our coffee.    The coffee was a bit sour, which happens when the coffee is under brewed.  We do it ourselves at home once in a while, but we're not paying 2.50 per Dixie cup.  The scone was actually pretty decent but I was looking for a pastry, not the limited option of scone, muffin or cookie.  Even so, I wouldn't rate so low if the coffee was good at the coffee shop.

W0dLozOJw_LukL4SpqL4wA.text: The service was wonderful, and it's a tidy, well-kept shop. My latte was good, but not quite a five-star.

IiYdg8yIlgXRge4Mj4HFKw.text: Simple, but efficient  I didn't really know what to expect from this place. My friend has been hyping it for weeks, so I finally decided to check it out. I loved the vibe when I walked in. It was, surprisingly "hipstery"? (Is that a word?) but pleasant. It was definitely nothing like the typical Starbucks or other coffee chains. The menu was basic and to the point, and I didn't feel overwhelmed by the number if choices or fillers that a lot of other places I've visited. The iced green tea I had was outstanding. Overall, I was happy with my visit. Ill definitely be back

xNDvTtx1gY6f6BDjCo3kbQ.text: Rude and discourteous employees. No horchata latte. Bummer waste of time. Phoenix and Tempe Cartels are completely different.

VojINzKcd8ovENp2kJ3DZg.text: Great place.  Very friendly staff.  The seating is eclectic but comfortable.  The coffee was off the hook. I would totally come back.  Parking is free and there seems to be plenty of parking.  It is on the street, but diagonal slots so more cars can fit.

1fUnZX7Zwz5jezh0MkwqZg.text: This is hands down the best coffee shop in Arizona. I have been coming to the 5th Ave location for 3 years now. The baristas are like family and they treat their family right! It took all of the baristas no more than 3 trips from me before they knew what I wanted and had it ready by the time it was my turn to pay. As I always state, attention to detail is what sets a business apart and Cartel is fully focused on the details.  They boast a strong pastry section with the chocolate chip cookie, my favorite, leading the way. They will accommodate any order and always have fun facts about the great coffee you're about to enjoy. They have all the best methods of brewing including the Chemex.  The one thing that sets them above all other coffee shops, besides the coffee and pastries, is the music. They are always playing the coolest playlists and they don't discriminate. I have heard everything from 2Pac to The xx to 80s jams.   After studying for 3 Bar Exams here, I can truly say there is no better place to get your coffee fix while enjoying great music and a great atmosphere.

-63H20zus0zAWQP9-pYuXA.text: What can I say? This is just an awesome place. It's pretty rare to find a good coffee shop in Scottsdale, but Cartel goes above and beyond. Extremely knowledgable baristas, high quality coffee, excellent atmosphere, great location... the list goes on.  I used to head to the Tempe location whenever I wanted a serious cappuccino, but now I can get that at the Scottsdale location without wading through a sea of argyle-sweatered, wayfarer-ladened, vegan hipsters.  Thanks Nate, Skyler, James, Kris and Sparky for making this an awesome office-away-from-office for me.  P.S. - Nursing student w/ the earplugs who enjoys a nice cab with her Saturday night study sessions.... where did you go?

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast of postironic champions.

YTlybYg_YmLGTXwXxmiGSQ.text: SO much friendlier than the downtown phx location. The girl barista there is just ugly to me every time I walk in. The barista here was super playful and nice. Best coffee around!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte and amazing muffin

clSHHhesxPDKtEVqwC9sCQ.text: 5 stars for friendly people, and 5 stars for good coffee.. but 1 star on the amount of ice Cartel puts in their drinks.. I paid $8.00 for 2 small drinks (1 mocha, and 1 chai) which were more than half way filled up with ice. Took me 1 min after walking out the door to finish my delicious chai.. what a disappointment.. just which that I could have had more.

0XTnoJ_ozxS7gjysPuHNfQ.text: CARTEL COFFEE LAB is awesome. The coffee is delicious and the staff very knowledgable and speaks to the detail of their coffee beans, roasting and preparation. The shop is tiny, clean and fresh. They also serve wine and beer. I didn't try any. Location 5th and Craftsman has plenty of free parking. There's also a cool bench out front where you can sit and sip.

sg7kj6ZUGYudndI3VN6MwA.text: Best coffee I had in Phoenix (despite having to drive 35 minutes from my hotel to get there).  Would have gone every morning had it been closer.  Good service.  Cool decor.    Went in asking for a dark roast, not pour over.  And their drip was everything I could have asked for.  Tons of flavor without that burnt Starbucks taste. It was what I needed at 7 am.

WjXZBPgTo94RnWT_ofptAA.text: I'm so happy this location exists! I am a die-hard fan of Cartel's black market espresso for my home machine, and it's easy to get my fix here since we find ourselves in old town on a regular basis.  We buy 3 bags at a time since they comp our drinks with the purchase. I always get a toddy to go, and I love the simple syrup pump they have out because I can quickly sweeten my drink.    The staff is pretty nice and polite, no attitudes detected here. One server even took the time to explain different techniques to make iced coffee when I asked about some of their equipment.  The coffee itself is my absolute favorite. It's smooth while still providing a good caffeine kick. It has comletely ruined us. It's not cheap, but I justify the splurge since my morning cappuccinos are what gets me out of bed in the morning.

EgFrMiCdA_AywjS7dED_GQ.text: My experience w/the barista was that he was not very friendly. Took almost 40 min to get two coffee orders. This was my third time here & I would say all three times I've had a similar experience.

FvHL7cNxl8S0wCJrucJKpA.text: Best coffee! Made in an artisan way. Each cup individually made.  greAt atmosphere looks totally hip. Good music. Very clean.  Very polite patrons hangout and converse.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy customers

xEmhvcIFp3FC4ceeFSqhog.text: after tommy v's happy hour, decided to walk to cartel for a little caffeine fix.  I ordered the chai tea latte with soy and i don't remember what Aileen ordered. the drinks come out with coffee art foam, nice touch. i also had a sugar cookie and it was moist and yummy.  i might return if i was in the area but sorry i really enjoy starbucks espresso and i drink it at home in my machine all the time and starbuck's is close to home. overall a cute coffee spot to hang out.

Le6tJsg9_reKyMgo36gaNQ.text: Great tasting coffee, and awesome prices!  I get my growlers filled with their cold brew and  the prices are unbeatable for the quality of coffee.   Highly recommend!

OUyiW6W6_nC_6hM2RljeRg.text: Hands down our favorite place for some quality beans and drinks. Also, our favorite Cartel location. We love this location because of the staff is incredible nice and the vibe all around is completely chill. The hubby enjoys an espresso while I sip on a latte or drip coffee. They also have an amazing chai!  I really enjoy taking home a bag of El Limonar beans. Whenever we have these beans at home I become smeagol and cherish my beans. However, I end up brewing cup after cup. From start to finish, the taste and smell is exquisite and I want it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7w_azDHZNTup13EAG9Jgcw.text: Cartel went from zero to hero in my heart.   They introduced me to Chemex brewing (my new personal choice), and I have had several pleasant experiences since my first visit.  Since August, their ordering system seems more intuitive, the only employees I've been encountering are very patient yet highly efficient and they've reorganized the place.    Way to go Cartel.  You've officially changed my mind.

vlNFKqPDD7FW-0W6fLiBGA.text: Very nice coffe shop.  Nice atmosphere.  The drinks were excellent.   I will be returning there the next time I'm in old Scottsdale.

N0Bjp4iBrnwzAvXpKABrNQ.text: Now that's a tasty latte!  I really liked the coffee joint that used to be in this space, but Cartel has taken serving awesome coffee to a whole 'nutha level by serving up fresh, delicious food, beer and wine!  Since my man doesn't like coffee, I have to have something like beer to lure him into a coffee shop.  Thank you Cartel for keeping relationships together!!  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte!

pX_SbdWDs_HvVBw2RrVJIQ.text: There's nothing I love more than a cozy coffee shop. In Saint Louis, you can toss a quarter and hit a coffee shop, here however, it's a little more sparse....maybe a handful of quarters and you can hit a Starbucks. There's nothing wrong with Starbucks, as the owner of Cartel Coffee told us, "there's a time for Starbucks and there's a time for a fresh, good pour". I like her. I like this place. It works.       The decor is bare bones, industrial-esque and I love it. Two chaises by the front windows are good for lounging and beyond that, there are wooden tables, replica wooden stumps, and some outside patio seating on the side as well. It's simple, it's down to earth, and you can get a damn good cup of coffee. Their dirty chai is wonderful, the fresh pours are delicious and truthfully, the pastries I've been eying are getting harder and harder to resist. They also have a variety of beers and wines to pick from if you're working from home, grading some papers or just really need that end of the day drink.      They've been featured by BBC Travel and Food and Wine Magazine which means, maybe I'm not the only one who thinks this place is a freakin' gem in Scottsdale. I wish there were even more coffee spots like this, but I can't deny my affections for Cartel. Don't miss out on a great cup of coffee and a perfect opportunity to people watch!

Ysht4lnZsxXOwxiQMe7GfA.text: Wow. I wish all the Cartels locations were like this. Professional, articulate and MATURE staff at this location. Great coffee, great recommendations on wines. What a relief.  Upper management take note: whoever is running this location, let them take the reins. This place runs circles around the Tempe and airport stores.

L4k1bfrUkQpfcBtIbyVdUg.text: Coffee is fantastic, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. There's just a general apathy on the part of the employees, I've noticed.

0UhbutGrOtxcyV1ge4F0TA.text: AMAZING COFFEE! I love the location and the atmosphere. Great meeting spot or quick stop to grab coffee.

8HIMizcrEs5VraQeRp_H3Q.text: I really enjoyed my Golden Milk Snickerdoodle because it was different and soft and chewy. But I think I would rather try the latte with coconut milk, which they do not offer. I tried oat milk for the first time ever and it was a bit of a disappointment. I have heard the other pastries are good so I might return to try something new, in the near future. The vibe is good but it's not my cup of coffee.

cZCFSJYD2FW3948ORS-5LA.text: We enjoy going to the place because it's not loud and a lot of the people are working or reading So those are the things that we want to do when we show up there  And my husband likes the Coffee a lot and I have herbal tea which works for me and the place is fairly comfortable and close to our condo and we enjoy our time there  The barista seems friendly and we come back on a fairly regular basis and we are not part of the young hip scene as we are considered senior citizens 65 and over and yet we are very comfortable there

lqkuobwcQ502gWngD_mDkw.text: Overpriced. Coffee is good, but $4.75 for an Americano?? Press has comparable coffee down the street and is much more reasonably priced.

4p8YT8xffRbqNZ9G6-dVQQ.text: The coffee here is incredible even when the employees who have little common sense screw up everything possible. Like seriously? Room for cream = filled to the brim? Asked for the new oat milk and the girl at the counter gave an empty carton then had the nerve to ask "oh do you need more? Like yeah hunny, you're no longer working at the idiot convention, snap out of it

Bn9bBvUmh8gv0DpIE9pxFA.text: Wowwowwowowowie! This is coffee at its finest! I wish Cartel was closer to home for me in KC since it is on par with the best stuff I've had at home.   Location, location, location is key for Cartel. Old Town is Scottsdale is uber-hip, chic, and the perfect place for this hipster paradise to call home. My apples to apples comparison for my coffee cravings is black drip coffee. Cartel's offerings didn't disappoint and represented the black coffee game with style. My wife's vanilla latte was equally delicious in addition to the homemade pop tart.   There was also a great mix of patrons walking in early on a Friday morning. Professionals, touristy types (us), students, and others all came in picking up varying drinks from lattes, to cold brews, to growlers.   Will definitely scout a stop here in the future. Really enjoyed everything about my visit and will continue to patronize small coffee shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good stuff to get going this morning

c_D7_J9jlGslLEboLLIqmg.text: I LOVE cartel's oat-milk vanilla lattes! It is also a great environment for meetings, as well as studying, as they have a back room which stays extremely quiet. My favorite coffee shop in the area.

VwqXbomoGFNHlT6ZbvCGaA.text: I'll start off by saying the coffee is pretty good.  However that's not where my issue is.  I went in to get a large black coffee today- the price rang up to $4.50!!!!!  For a plain black coffee, nothing fancy.  I asked if their prices went up and the person behind the counter said she didn't know.  How do you not know, I know a large coffee was $3.75 just a couple weeks ago.  Anyway, there's nothing anywhere about the 17% inflation!  I then asked if they had refills, the person at the counter said, yes but they're not free, they're about a dollar.  So I just went in to get my dollar refill and it was $2.25!  Second time in one day I was price mislead.  That's a total of 6.75 for a cup of coffee and a refill.  Again, the coffee is fine but will not return due to being misinformed on the price of my items.

JXCsVAm-wsDyVYy_tGqnbw.text: It's meh. Espresso is too acidic and flat towards the end. Given the fact there are many other place in the vicinity, skip it.

gjFu5VQspypD9xj80OTJ_A.text: Cartel uses bitter beans accompanied by bitter slow service.  Waited 25 min for 2 Americanos which finally arrived at wrong size.  Barista decided to now split them into 2 with disregard for my request that one has plenty of room so it's stronger tasting.  Sadly, experience left me longing for a Starbucks!

Btwxx1CFpL4mPkFM74absA.text: Some things that stuck out right away, lots of seating and lots of wall sockets that are somewhat evenly distributed. The menu and the coffee is 4 stars at best. When they get busy, I noticed a significant difference in the quality of their service (Especially their americanos) Location is great and there's usually a lot of options for parking. WIFI here is fast and reliable. They took the effort to install Multiple access points to prevent bandwidth throttling. Essentially, I love coming here to get work done but not for the coffee.

WziRKBbeTXMa4_WUI4Ah8g.text: This coffee shop is pretty dope. They have beer, and coffee how could you go wrong right?!?  It's located in old town, so day dependent parking can be a challenge.  They have a lot of space to sit down and work, or make calls.  They only have two size cups. I believe it's 8oz and 16oz, but don't bite my head off of those aren't the exact sizes but two sizes regardless.  Place has a little bit of a hipster vibe, and they definitely take their time making the coffee. I know a great latte is worth a bit of a wait but this wait (with no one ahead of me) was overly long. So I wouldn't go there if i was rushing to work but I would certainly head over on a casual Saturday or a late start day.

dEg6yR5kkUMqlKLmB6IUdQ.text: I visit here probably once a month when I go to the area. Service is ALWAYS top notch. I enjoy their coffee and selection of baked goods. Yesterday Raha waited on me. What a nice, pleasant person she is. The biggest draw for me is the "funky Seattle atmosphere" of the place. Having lived in downtown Seattle before, it takes me "back home". If you haven't been to Cartel Coffee Lab in Scottsdale...put it on your list.

NJ6mxVe1Vwtvs6Q5ZTV9nQ.text: Coffee is good. Very good In fact  But I give this here low score why because the two cappuccinos we got was barely served low warm.  U.N. excusable for a store specialist in coffee services   Hugs.

z8vpi7vstPccDWl7dbK4Xg.text: OMG... Best coffee ever! Drinking a "Mullet" made by Mr. Mullet himself! Sooo good! Please open up a lab in NorCal!!!!

AkWvOOnvkOleKK0mbi6Amg.text: Friendly staff, awesome cold brew, convenient location, plentiful parking, free wifi. Would definitely recommend!  It's a pretty small space with limited seating and outlets - perfect for a coffee date, quick catch up session, and small group projects, but it's probably not the best place to study at. Plus, their chairs really aren't that comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small cold brew ($3).

RV3--oCZI57kOxb4BW6VWg.text: This is and will probably always be my favorite coffee shop. Although I don't live or work near this location anymore I stop by anytime I am in the old town area. Their coffee is great. I always order a cold brew, a small in a large cup with extra ice. The employees always remembered and were super nice about it. Many of the friendly faces I knew and loved have since moved on from this location, but their product and atmosphere is still top notch. This location is more intimate than their Tempe location which I prefer as it was easier to get to know the employees and other regulars. I highly recommend, although it is not for Dutch or Starbucks lovers. They don't do crazy flavors, their menu is very simple and designed for a sophisticated pallet, someone who enjoys coffee for the taste of coffee, not for people who mask the flavor so they can get the caffeine.

lEjULV87cDzmihMwd0j0Yw.text: Awesome little coffee shop with a great laid back and unique vibe. They have some of the best cold brew and I love that you can buy a growler of it to take home.

d6ZVdkhSCJQQUBDbwBvPyA.text: My husband and just left the Cartel Coffee Lab. We ordered a black coffee and a vanilla latte. Both coffees had a terrible taste. I'm not sure why it tasted so funny. We threw the coffees away and left.

r9O2unZyedVgtcgDbz5JQA.text: Love their ice vanilla coffee. This place only has some pastries so not much to choose from if you look for breakfast

FZkfpWdKuFcx0MZw54DpYg.text: Best coffee place that we found in Scottsdale .. This is a destination stop if you are out that way!

jIFJXRV8bSFDhj0VkUnTCA.text: Love this shop. The location is wonderful and the atmosphere is very charming. Love all the drinks and the friendly employees. Also really like how their is separate seating if you need a quieter area. Their lattes and brewed teas are my favorite!

xynaz1AmDya7l0kOpYvUvw.text: I'm giving one star only because it was suppose to stay open till 10pm but when we got there 9:20pm the door was locked and the guy working there totally ignored us and other customers trying to get in.  I thought how ironic as the door has a sign that says yelp love us and it was indicating that it was still open.

oiEPg8px3gOr315-FoTicA.text: I don't know about you, but for me coffee tastes so much better when it's served by someone who knows far more about coffee than I do, and isn't afraid to say so. I have been searching for a coffee shop that is willing to show me how little I know about coffee and offer me a chance to learn the *correct* way to drink it, and boy did I find it.   If I hadn't come here, I never would have learned that drinking a cappuccino in the car was just terribly gauche. I would have been ignorant of the fact that the *correct* temperature is precisely 20 degrees cooler than what the (ugh) general populace would prefer. If you want a hot, to-go cappuccino you might as well go to Starbucks with the rest of the mouth breathing, robusta-drinking, non-fair trading, multiple-sourcing, GMO-endorsing cretins. And I hope they scald your mmilk

MOqAvJLheY41IfxUE3cozg.text: The coffee is solid but the service is mediocre at best. Very little service. The word hipster comes to mind. Seems as if they are bothered by your order

0TxK_18E5MeWXjQxAr5_MQ.text: Some of the best hand dripped coffee I've had since Philz in San Jose!

XBNH6vFnyP8e2M-UXkM-Ag.text: The coffee is really good. Cool to see them roasting it there. They also have beer on tap.

MjKIP1VbjeEeTHLnAXUkMQ.text: This place is really cool. Good coffee, the staff was nice, and my coffee cake was good. It's super cool that they also have a handful of beers on tap, one of them, Mr. Pineapple, had me drooling- it looked so good.  The ambiance is really cool and comfortable and looks like a great place to sit and chill. It would be cool if they had a few more baked goods for morning grab and goes, but there is only so much space.  Cartel is yet another great reason to support local coffee, skip the chains- and enjoy.

A3o7WU4WBN8QlA02sxJUEw.text: It was already scorching hot here in AZ and I wanted to stop at the Coffee shop for an ice cold drink.  I just got into town and my friend was driving into Scottsdale area.   I looked up the coffee places on Yelp on my phone and luckily found several Coffee shops on 5th Ave.   I'm glad I walked into this place out of many Coffee shops in the neighborhood after having their tasty **cookies(Chocolate/Peanut/Bacon & White Chocolate/ Macadamia) and a delicious **Chai iced latte w/soy milk :P. Their Chai iced latte was one of the best I've ever tried before!!  It's a "trendy" coffee shop type of place. When I walked in, there were several people  sit around either working on their laptops or reading books.  I really like their very modern style of mismatched colorful furniture.  I enjoy the chalkboard menus on the wall as well.  It seems like they serve quiet a few selection of beers and foods:)  To my surprise and amazement, they had an alcohol beverage and keep in mind, this is a coffee shop. Most notable Wow, I would never thought this place might sell beer...   A place to come and do some work on your laptop sipping coffee and then transition to beers later in the day-sounds awesome!!  Maybe some people might think it doesn't look exactly a beer destination place, but I can see myself having a glass of cold beer on a hot summer night :P.  Definitely, it's a relaxing spot to enjoy a pint, or less in my case.  Don't forget., thumbs up for the Chai Latte!

_2H869YoqochbjtNB5LzPw.text: The experience at Cartel is exactly what you'd expect at an independent coffee shop. The locale is artsy, the interior is sparsely decorated with geometrically abnormal tables at weird heights, wood and steel stuff and an exposed wood ceiling. If you're into wood and steel, Cartel has it. They were bumping dubstepLite from the overhead speakers, which was an unexpected change from the guitar + hi high and bass drum + croaking off-key vocals that hipsters seem to love. The dudes at the counter were wearing a sufficient quantity of second-hand clothing to make me certain that they weren't employees of a corporate chain, but that they were actually fulfilling their destinies as bearded Ferrymen helping the uninitiated cross the Single Origin river into the Alterlife. Among other customers there was a distinct lack of True artistic souls, which is disappointing, but really out of the control of Cartel. No one had a typewriter, or was knitting, and only one guy had the messy dreadlocks of someone who hasn't sold out. SOMEthing needs to be done before Cartel gets a reputation of being a scene for sellouts and generics.  Enough about the scene, on to the coffee. I had a black single-origin Chemex from somewhere in the global South, and the wife had the coldbrew. The Chemex is 20 oz., which is cool, but $8~. I guess if you think of it as two coffees it makes sense, but $8~? That's almost 50 cents/ounce. "Well, you were dumb enough to buy it," you might argue. Don't use your laissez-faire logic on me, I expect my independent coffee to be fair trade, not free trade. Still, the flavor was mild and spicy, and the mouthfeel...whatever, it tasted like good coffee. The wife's coldbrew was good, but also a little overpriced. Cream is kept under the tight control of the bearded Ferrymen, probably to keep it fresh, and is served infused with non-verbal judgement over your poor choice of diluting the integrity of your carefully crafted beans. This bit of judgementalism restored my faith a little in Cartel. Maybe they have what it takes to be an elite hipster joint after all. Then on our way out the door I overheard one of the Ferrymen describing to Dreadlocks how one of the blends as "totally cleanses your system," and reassurance washed over me. Cartel isn't just selling coffee after all. It's curing people of their ailments and helping them towards a healthier, less skeptical lifestyle.  Great for: people who enjoy the free market Not great for: people who believe in evidence based medicine

kJ65uTjjZgksixMwywANcQ.text: Blasting heavy metal, industrial decor, and a menu showing love for coffee contrasted against the difficulty of having a conversation and the coffee itself, which failed to deliver on its promise.   Another reviewer referenced Portland - they take their coffee and customer experience much more seriously. Still, it's nice to see someone in Arizona making an effort.

H5lTx3G0jau3vJXrMQXv6g.text: 5 star coffee/service help and knowledge, 4 star ambiance, 2 star food.  As I understand, the "cool" coffee shop scene and options are lacking in Phoenix relative to my home in Denver. But this place has it. They take their coffee seriously and understand it well. Barista was friendly, helpful, and informative. The coffee was excellent (had the Puerto Verte). All are medium to light roasted. The slower speed of service seemed to be a product of brewing to order.   The breakfast sandwich was good but pricey for what you got. It also had meat in the egg patty (which was not advertised on the menu). And NO condiments (salt, pepper, ketchup, hot sauce, etc). WTF?

lWrNLtth9QjFcQ0RBcqvdg.text: Enjoyed my regular brewed coffee very much, but the latte drinker gave it a "meh" and took a LONG time to get drinks.  Kind of a hipster place.  I think for the amount of time it took to get coffee on a Sunday morning, I'd pass.

i5MK9sdsO2Hn4lkMQuc6vw.text: After a satisfying meal and a nice stroll in Old Town Scottsdale, it was coffee time.  I didn't want to go to that useless overpriced overhyped Starbucks and my friend, a local in this area, took me here.  The coffee was strong but not bitter.  Perfect.  The atmosphere has a coffee shop yuppie feel, but I'm not complaining.  Come by for your java fix and leave satisfy.

flm22w_WMaZkDovIkBPLrQ.text: Don't waste your money here... Not even worth the free wifi.  1) Coffee is mediocre and overpriced... $3.75 for a drip coffee? Really?  2) Employees are pretentious, too much attitude for a job a donkey can do.  3) Dirty dirty dirty! Employees must be too busy smelling their own farts to wipe down tables and chairs, or clean the bathroom, or sweep the floors.  4) It's an ideal place for homeless looking folks that link their identity with the coffee they build their debt on (These are the people that rate this place more than 1 star)... 5) Also a good place for douche bags that talk loud enough for everyone to know what they're selling.   Find another place to get your drug...   Cartel... is a sell out.

Chu6Iy2IotsXDKQkM8zNPQ.text: I always enjoy grabbing an iced or hot vanilla latte at Cartel. Definitely one of the best places for baked goods, their banana bread is to die for! The staff is much friendlier here than the Tempe location. It's a wonderful atmosphere and when the weather is nice it's great to sit out on the patio.

BmtD0pz_UcK88JWK93VIOA.text: One of the best coffee places I've been to.  My first toddy was here at cartel and I fell in love with toddies. I love the atmosphere. You can sit and catch up with a friend or get work done. Highly recommended!

MaY1y_v18OZum9HRzf83cQ.text: Having already mentioned Cartel, my second visit to the small shop on 5th would be much longer than my first as I spent nearly two hours reading, listening to Who/Hendrix/Stones/Zeppelin/Floyd, and drinking an excellent Toddy of 50/50 Black Market Espresso and Viota.  Having obviously grown their fan base and selections (now including breakfast/lunch/dinner/pastries) since my first visit nearly one year prior when I came out for my job interview/recruitment I still love Cartel and stand by my original assessment that both the shop and the beans compare favorably to spots in New York, Chicago, Seattle, and San Francisco - I'll have to come back some time to check out the pastries and sandwiches.
