Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XX5EDdW-1Lsxfa4963ZUWQ.text: Try the cold brew.  They brew it overnight which makes for a very smooth and easy to drink beverage. It's perfect for the 107 degree heat.

e_UxTarTzsO_sEBtIcKl6g.text: I don't drink coffee, my tummy doesn't like it...well I should say it gets VERY angry when I drink even diluted coffee drinks.  The interior is trendy urban industrial, and there's a huge fan to keep their covered outside area as cool as possible (still not cool in AZ summer, but I appreciate the obvious effort).  I've only had two drinks here: the iced chai latte and the orange blossom beer, both of which went down quick and well.  Orange Blossom Beer is locally brewed and has a persistent orange sicle note. Yum!

32YGkz8NHhWCxsRV7g_rrQ.text: By far my favorite coffee shop in all of Arizona! I think I have been to pretty much everyone in the valley.  This place has fueled my temptation to quit the 9-5 and do freelance out of a coffee shop all day! Nothing better than a dirty chai and an evening chilling on a chaise lounge chair! I almost lost all faith in Cartel after attending the Tempe location several times and getting bad vibes from the employees every visit. However I am glad I got over my "cartel" fear and checked out the old town location. This place is a 180 deg difference from the tempe location. I was greeted by a helpful, friendly staff that doesn't come off as coffee snobs, because their is nothing worse than a barista with an attitude. Keep up the friendly staff and great atmosphere and I will be a life long patron!  Plus they have a small but great selection of craft beers!  Prices are on par with all other coffee shops in the area. Wireless internet is free and consistently works well.

jFZ_sAyjXMkFBH7FOrhh0A.text: I love me some Cartel! Checked out this space with a friend on a Saturday afternoon, and was pleasantly surprised to see it wasn't too busy (though still comfortably full!) and that I probably could've brought my laptop here to work for a few hours if I had wanted to.  Coffee was delicious, as always, and service was quick. Perfect location near parking too, which was a plus!

y9NiL22UD90FHgPGNsbw_g.text: Great coffee, great staff, awesome atmosphere. This was my first time in Scottsdale and I loved this area. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

jSVy93JTZ4Ub9N44tk-4gw.text: I was here tonight for the first time and loved it! The ambiance is so much better than the Tempe location (which I love too). The tea I got was amazing, the staff were friendly, and they serve alcohol too. Will definitely be back to this lovely spot!

vX_Ry3K1nMJyejLH3wdEQQ.text: Not my favorite coffee, I have had coffee all over the world. And have never had something taste so acidic, and burnt. It's hard to screw up a latte or even a mocha, yet both times they have not been right.  Barrista's are too busy chatting and texting to acknowledge  the  customers. Extremely hyped up for sour and bitter tasting coffee  I shall not make it a third time . Usally 3 strikes and your out, sadly not this time 2 times was enough,  Plenty of other places to go for better coffee and much friendlier Barrista's.

2CEnx69yFW9ynvoMYRSJPw.text: Best coffee in Scottsdale. A definite Starbucks alternative. Easy access to old town. Grab a coffee and walk around the art studios. The caffeine push will make you buy a new piece of artwork or possibly just pose for a selfie.

XOfhaO606-Xq1gqBvvBdMQ.text: Very expensive for what you get, the ambiance is weird and overly millennial focused. The barista was rude and very slow to make one cup of coffee. Will not return. One vanilla latte was $6! They only have vanilla and agave flavours to add to the coffee.

GQLVIkJX7iz7YPD95XzpKA.text: I found myself in Old Town after hours searching for a productive workplace.   Coffee Cartel came up highly recommended on Yelp, and I decided to give it a whirl.   The environment exudes a modern and hip vibe.    The music was a bit loud, but I would unquestionably return.  This is an excellent alternative to Starbucks.

CV5SFHSerLM4nceyWeJ5fA.text: Cartel is really dependable for great coffee that hits the spot every time. I've gone to other coffee shops around the area but I always find myself coming back here. This is my go-to for soy lattes, but the mocha and chai latte are also amazing and the best I've had.

2BaEpxvnjfiYm8xl8COUEA.text: Out of all the coffee places in the area that I've been to (Berdenas/Regroup/Altitude/maverick/4tilfour) this is my least favorite spot- been here twice, twice the staff is not the friendliest & kinda stuck up...coffee is my least favorite as well and almost has a sour taste to it. The pastry I got was dry but I will give them that they have a bomb pop tart. Might give it another go,3x you're out though.

vWm7xWQjDK410Oyuyf1fuw.text: Coffee good, thought a bit expensive; but then, it's right in the middle of Scottsdale 'Old Town,' so guess that's not too surprising -- rents must be horrendous!

aDYWEHDASawzpfE3nOKMfg.text: Love! Coffee heaven! Multiple cold brews on tap and delicious baked treats. Our barista James was the best! Knowledgeable and great service. Thanks Cartel, great job!

eI-mLQv0pEC7YOvn_q26gQ.text: Proof that not all specialty coffee is created equal. Okay-- the industrial wood and metal. I get it. Check the box. Also, "coffee lab" sounds good, and hurray for Phoenix adding 3rd wave to its scene. But man... I feel like I've been to a lot of cities checking out coffee, and this one wasn't worth the hype. Granted, I'm basing this off one visit and not several.   Roast tasted over-done and flavor burned out.   The female who takes our money -- that's all she did. And i didn't see her crack one smile over the course of 30 min. Not even a pleasantry or a grunt. Ummm... Kindness is never out of style.   I'm not fond of places where you order a Capp or Latte and get asked "what size?" Just make it how you do it. But that's not the reason for knock.   The place felt dirty. Bad service. Burned beans. Not the experience I was hoping for. The homemade Pop Tart definitely salvaged the experience -- holy cow. Yum! And my wife's latte featured a solid espresso shot and even milk. So that raises the stars away from a 2-star experience.  Futuro is still leading the pack in the 602.

JyJmP3-UOgrjmylcDjtJxw.text: Meh. Pretty locations. Cartel used to be a haven for coffee, now it's pretty sub par compared to most shops in the valley. Old equipment + uninspired menu. Cold brew seems to have taken a nosedive from its former glory when baristas made it. Kegged, metallic, lifeless, with a price increase. Advice; buy whole bean, brew at home.

RCOV6WOSlhju9RSTUDkk1g.text: I had herbal tea which was brewed fresh and was wonderful also an americano which was very smooth and not bitter Cute local spot to check out

7ujWPsa5KPYsYJMTB2kDUw.text: Hands down the best cold brew I've ever had. It was so incredibly smooth and flavorful that it begs to be enjoyed without the adulteration of creamer or sweetener. I'm going back for another one in about 15 minutes, and I will try to get one more before hitting the road for LA this afternoon.

wF51sh3Bz1sLs0oRevaVqA.text: Best coffee I've ever had! I go for the large iced Mocha. Four espresso shots makes for luscious caffeination.

oSJFkw0Omt14MzOQ91Hdgg.text: I can't think of any other coffee shop that compares. Their espresso is top notch and I love that a size small is truly small.   The only thing I don't like is if you get a loose leaf tea, instead of putting it in an infused, they put the leaves in a boiling cup of water which gets very bitter because it's obviously over steeped. I can't for the life of me figure out why they do this.   Otherwise it's excellent

uoeI8jQkLH7QSeXQ3TGoxg.text: Cartel Coffee Lab Old Town Scottsdale is a quaint little hipster coffee shop in the north side of the 5th Ave. Shop district of downtown Scottsdale. The place was clean and quiet, with ample seating as well as a shared courtyard patio to the west. For all of the time it had been there, I had never known, since it gets hidden in the location.  The staff was very friendly. The service was fast, and I had my beverage and muffin in no time at all. I'm torn about the whole get your own lid thing, since my drink was full to the top and it was awkward juggling my stuff, the drink and the lid and straw. Eventually I got myself coordinated.  I ordered a blueberry muffin and a large iced chai.  The 16oz. Chai was underwhelming at a whopping 5 bucks! (even overpriced Starbucks has the Grande, 16oz. At $3.65) The muffin was tasty, with nice crusty sugar on top. A bit dry, but still pleasant.  I don't know that I would spend the money for a substandard chai in the future.  While I like to support local businesses and avoid the Starbucks monster, I think I will keep looking for that right place.

kQhSV3NBpUe7oT5dLn219Q.text: Cartel has been one of my favorite places to get a coffee and to work from. I like that they are constantly trying out new drinks and food items. Also, their affogato might be the best in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fn7ujCZKGbT96WT0RCGK-Q.text: Let's talk about Cartel Coffee Lab in Scottsdale. Let's!!  This place makes all of my coffee nerd/ trendy hipster senses tingle with glee. When you first walk in you'll notice there's art on the wall, and long couches, long tables. I actually love the furniture in here. There's a little indoor/outdoor hallway on the side that has a comfy couch and tables, one of which has a chess board, if you know how to play (which I don't).   Then the coffee stuff. This is what I love the most. They have all brewing methods. French press, chemex, aeropress, you name it. Not to mention a manual espresso machine and hand poured latte art. GAH!  The two guys working today are perfection. They are fun, friendly and efficient. Not to mention they make a killer latte. Yum. :)  Also, I had a blueberry muffin that made my tummy very very happy.   I love Cartel Coffee Lab. I will come back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced vanilla latte. Yes, please
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blueberry muffin... Made properly

bBnEUEf-v80kETez3hT7jQ.text: My favorite spot to chill, do homework or hang on a work break. I love the iced chais! Very relaxing atmosphere.

cZc9rD4Ob-3t9-eMa6e6dg.text: A little hipster slice of heaven.  It feels like they pulled this place right out of Telluride and plugged it.  Awesome coffee, they even have beer on tap.

xK-CanNN82Xfe2Rpf79w9Q.text: The coffee was great, service and food was not. It took the guy for we to make the food which was an English muffin and jam and cold butter in cups. And when I asked how the coffee was made, the guy explaining it was acting as if he was better and smart than me since I didn't know "cool coffee". Bad, support another local business if you want a quick bite and good coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cold butter, just okay jam and English muffin took them forever to make. Not to mention the price after all said and done.

yPRs0XbP8TSSpi9AF67XfA.text: Very good coffee, nice foam. Happy to have a place to leave my husband while I shop. There are power strips under the table and it seems like some people work from this coffee shop. Nice relaxed vibe, feels like the mission in SF.

tSbQGek5QMZlrcS1gqXVZw.text: Serious place with a very comfortable setup.  Didn't partake but appreciate the beer selections, more places should do this.  Espresso was excellent, didn't need sweetener like it does at some national chains.  Music selection was not my style (I am definitely older than the target market) but still interesting and enjoyable while working for a half hour.

rTRdNkrmPoGRT4q01G6vbw.text: Meh. After getting raves reviews from our hostess at Brush Bar we headed down to enjoy some coffee before heading home. The store is hipster and fun with a warm and inviting feel to it. The barista was friendly and very knowledgeable. The coffee was just meh for me though. In fact, my iced mocha tasted burnt. I didn't finish it. Maybe it was just an off time--I mean who normally goes to get coffee at 9PM...but I expect the coffee to taste as good at 9PM as it does at 7AM. Maybe that's just MY high expectations speaking tho.

OaTvM1wrZQIWYwKeAO9Btg.text: Good coffee, good service, love the location(although it can be hard to spot), and great patio. Pastries are tasty. We will be back!

Tact8SldCv2gNa6uIyVCMw.text: Cool theme for a coffee shop but nothing to write home about. The house cold press coffee I had was mediocre. They advertise four different ways to brew your coffee, however dont really provide a variety of different coffee blends to customize your brew. Overall, cool theme, ok coffee.

QbhPN1ch08FKS5gbahRpYA.text: Excellent little 3rd wave coffee shop in Scottsdale. They serve AeroPress here. Try it! Also, the prickly pear iced tea is excellent.

IQJ1YbpJAbxa4ILKNtW3Kg.text: For coffee devotees (nerds) only.  I liked the low key relaxing vibe.  Prepare to wait for your coffee.

lNAOsI5VTyKaz22xmXFeRw.text: Love this place. Coffee is great, and staff is friendly and fun. Careful though--if you're running short on time, this isn't the quick grab-and-go coffee stop. They make your drinks with love, and that takes a few extra minutes. Also have great pastries!

xYYKzL0B_ExuJe4CqMNjdA.text: Wow- they have the best cookies in the world!!!!  Very nice Staff and fresh Orange Juice.  I will have to say thumbs up to Cartel.  They really focused on what the customer needs and wants are.  Very happy to come back real soon!!!!!

1p-WYkOR4udPuL5VGKACDg.text: Sorry but if you are going to offer both beer and coffee you need staff it appropriately. You have craft beers and need wait in line to order a beer. Because if you sit at the bar you will be waiting awhile to be served. Ok so you wait in line but because a its craft beers perhaps you would like to taste one or two first. Well you can but you still have that line. So just not practical the way they are staffed.

zFYeQoK7_oiwMbB4p5GBoQ.text: When I found out there was a Cartel Coffee Lab in Scottsdale I made sure I ventured out to try it as soon as possible. Which happened to be the next day. I love the location in Old Town. It's off the main street so it's a bit more quiet and has a great funky industrial feel inside. I had espresso and my husband had a hot latte. The latte was perfection, and my espresso was spot on. We also tried a couple of the pastries. I definitely recommend their cinnamon roll with cream cheese frosting(It had a hint of citrus in the frosting). Yum. I will definitely be back.

5T1dkjEEgzatFAreRcMalw.text: This is a local chain in Phoenix. Outstanding coffee choices. Usually they have 4 or 5 to select from origins like Honduras, Guatemala & Ethiopia. The size of your cup usually determines the type of pour-over method. Be prepared to wait but sometimes waiting will give you an outstanding result.

tEsXuc7RG3USeJu2ipE7yw.text: Top notch coffee and espresso here with polite staff, and my goodness I sincerely hope this is the new norm of having draft beers at a coffee shop.  Amazing.  High marks for the aforementioned reasons.  However I just don't care for much of the customer base here, especially the younger kids who seem to occupy the limited table space for lengthy periods of time.  Rather have the mid career to older demographic at many restaurants in this area.  Parking can be challenging at times as well, but that's not surprising for the area.

x711WJY2RzNxMWCwgExwPQ.text: Cartel has great products and I've never been disappointed with any of their drinks. However, it may take a half hour to get it. I know they are completely different from a place like Starbucks, but when there's 5 or 6 people in line at Cartel, it will absolutely take 20 minutes to get your drink, which is absurd and ridiculous. A place like Sbux would take 5 minutes. Let's give Cartel the benefit of the doubt with their solo machine and manual tamping. Even if you triple the time, you're still waiting longer at Cartel. Never go there if you are in a hurry. If my drink was ready just minutes after I order it, I'd be giving them 5 stars. Since they ALWAYS take forever, they get 3, it's that tough. Their drinks are delicious and I'm sad I don't go there often but it's not worth a 20 minute wait.

v34E2YfUKH16vPGppC0hlg.text: The coffee and atmosphere are great here. I love to visit local coffee shops and this one is now at the top of my list.

3geqVOj8gwHnuf7yN1slEw.text: I found Cartel Coffee Lab in Scottsdale to have kind of an interesting vibe. It has an industrial feel to it inside, not homey or inviting. There is long bench-style seating in their main room which was very warm even at 9 a.m. Then there is a side "breezeway" area (much cooler) with standard tables but not-so-comfortable chairs. There's also a sterile looking back room if you want total quiet. There is comfortable, unobtrusive music playing in the background. The coffee offerings are limited (don't expect a Starbucks) and an even smaller offering of pastries, but they do offer local craft beers. The barrista(?) behind the counter greeted us with more of a sneer than a smile, and coldly stated they did not have the dark roast coffee I asked for but had "lightly roasted coffee and roasted their own beans". Sounded more like a public address announcement than a benefit. What I actually got was and expensive cup of acidic coffee. I assume they have a loyal group of local customers who prefer "rustic" coffee and the story that goes along with it, but I prefer a good, reasonably priced cup of coffee instead. I'll probably not return.

-oxgscTkF8ZukvSkMAfjHw.text: I really enjoyed this place! I tried their iced latte which was very yummy. My sister got the iced chai latte which was also good. It reminds me of a hipster coffee shop in Los Angeles, CA called Intelligentsia. I love the fact that they have coffee and beer- pretty cool. I'll definitely be coming back here and introducing the place to my friends.

nKl8yYrcf8q5S0zeYZqulA.text: Terribly bitter coffee. Three of us ordered two coffees and a shot of espresso. My mom, who ordered a shot of espresso, ultimately threw it out after taking a sip b/c it was too bitter. An employee said it was bitter because it was organic and didn't ask if they could make something else or refund her money.   The girl at the register was extremely rude when I asked what size hot coffees they sold. She picked up an iced coffee cup that was covering the hot cups and looked down and it without saying anything and then looked at me like I was idiot.     I tried their coffee once before at the airport and wasn't too fond of it, but I figured I would give it another shot. Bad service and coffee?? No thanks Get a different coffee shop in there.

0k4UqxjJgSFGu4U8XULWGw.text: Great location in old town, but not really conducive to going on a coffee run because of old town parking. Great pastries. Staff is always friendly and helpful- I've read a few other commenters who suggest that they have a "typical hipster attitude." I'm not sure what that means... but they're always very friendly and help me decide on different beans for use at home, and have never had a bad attitude with me. I give 4 stars because I think their roasts are a bit acidic, so sometimes I've had a bad cup. Otherwise I love this place.

PQVxgEgayLvyyfH8vP2oXw.text: They have a very helpful and friendly staff. Lots of choices of coffee, and a couple beers and some wine if you're more in the mood for that. They were helpful in explaining the different types of coffee that they were offering and were patient with all my questions. I normally order a pour over and expect a Chemex but they also had the aero press and the v60 which are each slightly different. I decided to give the v60 a try since it was getting late in the day and didn't want a gigantic cup to keep me up at night.   There's a standard small selection of snacks (soft pretzel/muffins). I grabbed a pretzel since I needed a light snack after dealing with overpriced airport food all day. It was pretty tasty and not too salty. There was a nice sweet savoriness that was a pleasant surprise. Though, I did not expect it to be room temperature. Still delicious though!  Now let's get to the coffee. It was smooth as a pour over often is. Lots of different subtle flavors that I enjoy from a quality pour over.   It was brought out with the coffee in a separate glass jar with a lid. Presumably it's so you can pour out what you want to drink and the rest stays hot while you sip it, which I think is a genius move.   The ambiance is very chill with lots of people working and hanging out or enjoying themselves. The WiFi is also fast and reliable.   It's definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area and need a tasty drink or a light snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

i_wuFedki_Tm5RFg1BDZEA.text: Excellent cortado! Service was great. Baristas suggested an anniversary present, and it was spot on!

29ymeG7FDVkWW3E04CSRpw.text: Went to this shop solely based on reviews and pressure from teenage daughter. Needless to say, I was a bit skeptical. I wasn't wrong. This is an overhyped coffee shop, thriving on popularity. This is easily apparent by a quick scan of clientele hanging out.  Now I can deal with this type of environment if the coffee is worth it. Unfortunately the coffee is miserable. The staff were overly pretentious, but maybe not their fault, just a victim of the surroundings.

3FvOeLPkMfIndol-WrRAYA.text: This is one of the few coffeeshop in the valley where I can expect a good cup of coffee and be productive on a consistent basis. The place is cozy with simple earthy decoration, just the way I like it. Seems like people come here to get work done instead of catching up on what Becky and Chad did last Saturday. If any staff is reading this, please tell me the secret to looking cool so effortlessly... and the 365 good hair days too. Much thanks

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DutxrsWxwlNWZ4jJxRuQ8w.text: Waltzed in on a late Saturday morning wearing the same outfit, wedge shoes, and makeup I'd worn the night before. And sure, maybe my hair hadn't been brushed either but hey, a girl needs her coffee. I was hesitant to stop where there wasn't a drive-thru option but I didn't want Starbucks or McDonald's coffee either. Boyfriend stops in front of the shop and lets me out. Feeling slightly self conscious, I said "I'll take an iced breve or whatever your equivalent is," since I didn't see it on the menu.  The barista gave me a perplexed look and then turned to his coworker to ask what they might be able to make breve like. Next thing I knew they were asking for my credit card, charging me $5. A moment later they produced a cup filled with ice and coffee and, room for cream. I immediately resented the tip I'd left because I didn't ask for an "iced coffee room for cream."  Disappointedly, I grabbed my iced coffee and looked around for the creamer station (I wasn't sure where it was as nobody had directed me). Now, I realize a breve is basically just an iced coffee with a plethora of half n half stirred to a delicious creaminess, and that I could at this point make my own breve. But for what had I tipped at this so called Coffee LAB?  When I stop at a coffee shop I expect the barista to make my drink with love and hand it to me in a way that gives me the sense that despite messy hair or sloppy makeup, it's gonna be a damn good day. Next time, I'll go through the drive-thru.

Jkv4CprhmKyAo1FIyzd2fw.text: Definitely over-priced for just okay coffee.  How can they justify charging $4.50 for of cup of drip?  At most places you would be able to get at least a small cappuccino for that.  The only thing I really like about the place is the location.

yN2tDdrToZZwLpYxp2Cc9g.text: I love this space to meet a friend or to get some work done for a few hours. They have plenty of seating and a great selection of drinks. It's right on 5th Avenue so in general it's a great location in Old Town. The staff is always friendly and accommodating.

fe72I8gzrQCCUclMxZEMtQ.text: Came here a whim because I was in town for a dress fitting. I ordered a cold brew and mocha coffee. The workers here are polite. Coffee wise, both were very underwhelming considering the price tag and size of the drink. I certainly wouldn't come back here, the coffee really didn't stand out to me.

7z9r_Vs2BKB5W_f5GKkaEw.text: Obviously a step ahead of Starbucks but I would disagree the all the outstanding reviews in my experience. First of all it was a bad sign when I was asking the barista to comment between two choices of coffee and she said "I'm new here so I haven't tried all of the coffee's yet". Now I appreciate her honesty and I understand from an average coffee drinker's perspective that's probably not a problem, however being a self proclaimed coffee snob from California I was surprised that any well deserved and respectable coffee shop would hire someone and not put them through the process of at least trying everything they have to offer. I think her pour was a bit off, The coffee was missing its unique distinctive flavor as during the brew process the water probably spent too much time in the grind. Had the pastry which was unremarkable and rest of the staff has kind of a "Treat the regulars with more attention and gratitude then the other customers" kind of thing 2.5 stars Btw I was so disappointed in this experience that the next day I took a 18 minute one-way Uber to Press coffee with a much much better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5zcoK688qFqD60orTd_YCQ.text: For my first review of 2018, let's start off with a banger!!! Get ready for some fun with this one.   Let's be honest for a minute. The price of coffee (which I don't drink) or tea isn't getting any cheaper. But $4.25 plus tax for some water and mediocre tasting tea is absolutely insane to me. Starbucks for a size twice what I got is half the price...At freakin Starbucks!!!! Before you think I'm cheap or whatever, check my pics from the meals I ate and this actually has little to with price or money. I also secretly hate Starbucks.  One it took forever to get tea. Not hard to make, right?  Fair warning I was told it would be a few minutes. Whatever. I asked if they have honey. They said no, they only have agave and some nonsense flavored corn syrup out of a pump. How do you not have honey at a place like this?  Two stars for the decent atmosphere and crappy chairs. Although I'm curious about whatever is doing on their laptops...mmmm? Plus a lot of the light bulbs were burnt out and that drives me crazy because it lacks attention to detail. It's not that hard to change a light bulb.   I'm not sure if their rent is high or the workers/owners are, but this is all insane to me.   This review might sound mean but some of the foundational things in my mind are missing.

Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My frustration from this place. I took it out on the cup.
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $4.25 plus tax -__-

XEQF7-ye2L4biBpHlRGxkA.text: Amazing coffee.   I was walking around Old Scottsdale in search of breakfast on Easter morning when a lot of the other nearby coffee shops were closed. I ordered a cortado, which was excellent. It was very smooth - not bitter at all!   As far as other breakfast options at Cartel, there are some baked goods such as muffins and cookies, though you might need to go elsewhere if you are looking for something heartier.

fq_ZaKb_jrieouEqpup5Lw.text: If you love coffee as much as I do, then this is the place for you!! Just a taste of black coffee ( the only way to really know if the coffee is good. If you put sugar in anything it'll taste good) very RICH and CREAMY!! Every time I'm in old town I come here.   Customer service is great!! Very knowledgeable about the coffee beans they serve. Also very nice when it comes to clumsy people like me (I spilled my coffee everywhere while I was putting cream in it) they came and cleaned up my mess and brought me a new coffee!!

M0JN976JFIgSndvPEEMHjA.text: Best iced vanilla macchiato Great service and helpful staff. I would definitely come back to this coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ymV1v6BM_aQ90i7Dyjxv6w.text: Love good cup of chai tea with almond milk! I judge by if their using syrup or making tea fresh. Cartel is making it fresh as it taste so delicious! I almost drank the entire cup with one gulp! The one thing I did not care for was the small cups for the price. I would like to have bigger cup as this size would be gone in second with me. Taste I would give this place "A." Maybe next time I will get the bigger size as I know I like the drink. My mom got cold brew with little creamer and she was happy with taste as well but again her cup size is small as well. I will visit this location again as it has plenty of comfortable seating with tables to work or browse the Internet with laptop with free WiFi.

JsYsMg6ZIGXsE9qoJhotBw.text: Not the coffee I was expecting or the knowledge I was hoping to gain about different blends. Save your money and get a 'four-bucks' !

cxj-a2mGOkakk33tj-Gk3Q.text: Great customer service. Laid back friendly atmosphere!  Plain black coffee tastes good here! Just a little overpriced for plain coffee...I must be paying for quality.

OqPRe6RvLwvGO4tyhxhP-A.text: Fairly 'Boh Chic' yet a simple and inviting environment for superior coffee in many ways. We stopped by after sad restaurant brew and were elated. Came back 2nd day passing the drip pots w/ single origin washed varietals and waited for a pour-over.  Excellent. This wet wash process takes full advantage of  flavors otherwise discarded in the other methods. Fruit flavors like strawberry, watermelon, or other light aromatics is not your typical canned bean experience. Highly recommended.

EunL9O8IQKl0ESAShq3jPg.text: Douche bag central! The staff are the most unfriendly or stuck up ppl. Tempe location has better and more friendly staff.

Folj6CTqNcd5aSkpolUa0w.text: I tried to pry it out of them: What is the addictive chemical that Cartel puts in their coffee? Being a Denverite, I had to know: what can I do to get my fix while I'm not in Scottsdale?  Instead he gave me a list of his favorite coffee shops in Denver. Awesome service, amazing coffee and possibly an addictive chemical that creates the illusion of the best Iced Vanilla Latte you've ever had.   This location serves local beer and wine as well. I'll try to make it back for happy hour.

7RurIjKC4eXnYWZx4Ou_nA.text: Where I learned about Toddy Coffee and where hipster meets Arizona! love the portions, love that people are all on their laptops, love that it's part of Old Town...also love that they serve alcohol ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KYaFwpFLq-QauCIq62FHRQ.text: Cartel has been part of my coffee rotation for a few years now. I've visited all current locations and loved them all equally. This one in-particular is my favorite, with a bright and airy lounge to enjoy one of their specialty brews and a cool and comfortable patio, they really know how coffee was meant to be enjoyed. Six rotating taps of local beers along with wine, I make sure to visit at least once a week to see what new wonderful drinks they're serving.  Rather than bombard you with displays of miscellaneous drinks and snacks from 3rd party companies, (energy drinks, soda, bottled water, etc.) Cartel focuses on the only thing a coffee shop should; great coffee.  However, the costumer service is not as consistent as some of the other shops I frequent. I worked as a barista in a shop not unlike Cartel for a few years, and I understand that it's very hard to be at your best a hundred percent of the time, but I feel the staff could be a bit more honest and kind to their customers,  Still, I enjoy Cartel immensely and I'll still be stopping by for a quality brew when I can. Don't miss a chance to check out this little shop for a nice coffee and a relaxed vibe.

ma9wCpdvPvGcQ406LU0wMQ.text: I happened across this place when I was randomly invited over for an expression shot by a group of Weebly employees while walking past them on the street on my way to Chop Shop.   Only stopped in real quick for the shot and to chat with my new friends but I was impressed with the small space. We don't have any cafes like that in Utah. The shots of sparkling water prior to the espresso shots is a nice touch.

82zZy74oRhWg_OySs4F8XA.text: You cannot beat the coffee here! The taste the strength.... There's no other coffee house like it in town.

rorrb2F4JWj5hwLgSFafIQ.text: The longest I've ever waited for a coffee. Terrible service. And then it was bitter and weak. Very disappointing. Won't go back.

j9ssTGJ4OQxo5x_wAQsWhA.text: I feel a little idiotic because I have never been to the Cartel in Old Town until last night, and I had been missing out. I met a friend for a beer, and the barista- I think his name was Mikey? was amazing. He was super sweet, helpful and had amazing customer service. We stayed and played some chess, ended up being there until closing and Mikey simply came out to let us know we were welcome to stay as long as we liked, he merely had to lock the outside gate, which led to a hilarious conversation about old school tv shows including Legends of the Hidden Temple.  For being the only person in the store, he was attentive to everyone and as I mentioned, the customer service was impeccable. That's huge for a overcrowded place like Old Town Scottsdale.   Thanks for a great time! I will definitely be back again.

53rFW7YyITGCeCb-bOTSgw.text: Had a great experience here. Had a vanilla latte and split one of their amazing homemade poptarts. Didn't take too long for us to get our drinks like some of the other reviews said. Keep in mind we came here on a Sunday morning at that. The people who worked there also seemed really nice. Nice ambiance inside with lots of seating split between two rooms. Definitely a nice place too come and chat with friends over good coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade pop tart &amp; large latte!

4-Qmta-rwfSfuEZJQsvUNg.text: As a barista, I'm super picky about my coffee. I love trying out local coffee shops, and Cartel is my current favorite. They have a strong selection of blonde roasts, but no dark roasts here, unfortunately. They also have a few local beers which are entertaining to try as well.  I like both the Tempe and Scottsdale locations, but I tend to frequent the Scottsdale shop slightly more often. It's pretty quiet, and serves as a nice location to do homework, read, or produce music.

dlrjihcVgjlg4zuUT81M_A.text: This was a fun surprise to find near the convention center! The half and half was a fun midday treat and it's a good place to just relax. The cold brew was also smooth and well balanced. The iced chai was pretty disappointing for my friend so I'd recommend sticking to the coffee for patrons

GNjukIsNeexmultbpN7HZg.text: I am never in Scottsdale, ever. But this one time, I was on my way to my friends' house in Scottsdale when I was feenin for my espresso and  remembered that one of the coolest dudes I know (Don S.) raved about this place.   Dude was right. This spot takes the cake for flavor. Plus the lighing through the windows and the ambiance was on point.   I was pleased that they happily made a chocolate milk for the tiny.   I can't wait to come back and try some other things off the menu. Perhaps sometime for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2dBKnYsJv2eB6wFLFoE8qQ.text: If you appreciate quality espresso and coffee then this is a must. Best coffee in Scottsdale, and they have a location in the C Terminal at the Phoenix airport. Highly recommend!!!

eK8jLbr_AAFkHHiPTVGhWA.text: Stayed for 7 hours grading papers. Got the pop tart, Columbian natural-processed pour over, cortado, espresso, and a one-and-one. All were excellent. Awesome vibe and atmosphere. Definitely gotta check them out if you are in the area!

COfQasHbVv1wN-brksUR1g.text: Coffee, music, and buur...  I dig this joint!  It's like walking into a brew house with some random people hanging out.  Live music and freshly made coffee.  I have to say one of the best coffees I had in a long time.  I'm no coffee snob by any means, but shazam! This coffee hit the spot and punched me in the face "in a good way -- if there's such a thing as getting punched in the face, but enjoying it....", and woke my senses up!   What else is cool and I dig about Cartel is you can order alcoholic beverages.  Coffee and Beer -- Aside from water, my two most sought after and preferred drinks!  Cartel is like my kryptonite - I must succumb to your bidding....must be strong and ahhhh...more more coffee, more more, pleasssse! - Enjoy!

OxNDFVMuEdrg4N2OVGfLTQ.text: Hipster-y coffee in Old Town. You know I like me some tasty cappuccinos, but for some reason they wouldn't do a cappuccino to-go, that was a first... so I went with a latte. Fortunately the latte was excellent so I have no trouble forgiving them for a little coffee snobbery.

bj4LdnJmrLvCXXuCyT7yCg.text: Cartel is such a quaint little shop with such a great vibe from the very talented baristas. I've just moved in with a new place down the street & I've been in cartel a handful of times now & they already recognize me & know my order. How sweet! The coffee is delicious. I get a latte & its just so smooth and inviting! & for later in the day they feature beer on tap!? How cool!! Love love love! Keep up the great work guys!  Also, i dont know if they make them homemade, but the blueberry muffins they sell are to DIE for!

dCiRv7qBn8cA-U5lyvr_1w.text: It seems a lot of places are now offering Cartel Coffee and it's becoming more popular by the minute.   I really wanted to check out the hype and stopped by last Saturday around 10:30am. After reading a few reviews, I was under the assumption Cartel served some form of breakfast (sandwiches? Burritos?). When I asked the barista, he told me no and pointed to the display case of pastries. I was a little disappointed by this as I was starving.  Nothing in the pastry case really sparked my interest and I had two employees staring at me expectantly. Glancing up, I looked at the very simple menu and tried to gauge what I wanted. Feeling pressured, I ordered my standard go-to drink: a small vanilla latte. The latte was a tiny 8oz and $4 total. Needless to say, I was a little disappointed. (One of my favorite coffee shops has 8oz as their small size, but they list the pricing/sizing on the menu so I can make an appropriate decision.) Taking my drink to go, I slowly sipped my drink. It was a good, decent latte. Definitely better than any chains and a few other local shops I've been to, but not something I'd drive out of my way for.   A few weeks following my first experience, I decided to give Cartel another go. This time, I knew I wanted to try their iced coffee. I also ordered a large hot latte for a friend. After making the large latte, the barista poured my iced coffee and asked if I needed cream. I told him I definitely needed enough cream to make the drink a mellow khaki color. He then proceeded to take the left-over hot milk from the previous latte and pour it into my iced coffee. Two things. He asked if I wanted "cream" not milk. Second, he didn't give me an option to say no to hot milk being poured into my cold drink. Since I haven't been a barista for over 7 years, I decided to go with the flow and didn't say anything. He then handed me my drink and I proceed to add some simple syrup. (Next to the counter, there is a small area with sugar packets, lids, napkins, and simple syrup in a pump.) After adding some simple syrup, I took a tentative sip. I almost spit it out. The drink tasted like oranges. Strong, overpowering oranges. Oh god. I looked up at the barista, but he was already engaged with another customer. Not wanting a confrontation, I decided to take my paid-for drinks and go. I tried a few more sips of the drink, but just couldn't do it. It was horrible. I then drove down the street to another coffee shop (which coincidently served Cartel beans) and ordered a hot latte.   The hype sucked me in and I'm glad I gave it a try. However, I will probably never be back. There are so many other good local coffee shops near me that I would not go out of my way to drive to Cartel.

19ujHm7E4VdDBJPTsq2q5A.text: Taking another cross-country road trip and stopped in Scottsdale for a cup of coffee and not just any coffee, they know how to brew and in many different manners of brewing! Pick your coffee (they have a "green" buyer), add to the a roaster with over a decade of experience, baristas that know how to prepare your coffee (the final stage can make or break that cup of morning/afternoon madness) and you have yourself a "great cup of joe". A few fun snacks; soft pretzels, crazy cookies (forget you are "dieting"), scones, etc. Funky music in the background, 4 large communal tables and side couch with small tables if you want some alone time all works together. Easy free wi-fi (hate to get a code, type in some mysterious 17 digit code that never seems to work until after 22 tries) and pretty fast, too! It is not your dad's coffee place, so if you want a quiet, soft chair place to read your newspaper, this in not your place. Perhaps pick it up to go! This is a jolt of absolute heaven! If you want Nescafe stay home in your easy-rest sofa. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

QXjwLNG9FM-MV5e_3asKyA.text: OMG if you are in scottsdale and love good coffee,  got to try this place !! The cappuccino was amazing !! The gingerbread cake was fresh and tasty !

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cappuccino and Providencia coffee and gingerbread cake ! So delicious

JJchVxqsVhWv6e5j8KkjIg.text: Awesome spot.  Found it randomly after doing some yoga next door and needed a pick me up as I was in total zen mode.  It's a small, but cool and open spot with personality and vibe.  Came here to work as well and it was super chill.  I gave it minus a star because there's nothing out of this world about it, but it's still an awesome spot.

uj8Qaelf9gYatEIhuo-xAw.text: This place is fantastic - great coffee, beer, good music and space to do work if you need it.  The people who work here are extremely nice and attentive, and they all have a good sense of humor.

-LkqUwWX6NryLQ88sAV0WQ.text: BEST COFFEE. I buy a bag of beans every week. Friendly employees, lots of different options for the more distinguished coffee drinker. Try the cold brew when you go.

yNtYIDMmpVNPK4rt4GWBOw.text: I am a huge coffee fan so when I a heard about this place I was excited to check it out. It's great that there's another independent coffee house in downtown Scottsdale.  I liked the decor, free wifi, and the staff was friendly enough. I ordered a black coffee from Guatemala which was a little weak for my taste - I'll try something else next time.  I usually drink 4-5 cups of coffee house coffee per day and found the $4.25 (5.25 after tip) expensive for drip coffee. It was served in a pint glass which was strange but OK with the sleeve.   I'll stop by again but I gave it 4 stars because it's a little expensive to make it a regular place.

B9p6mV7Zn2OeBnte24JPGA.text: Loved this coffee shop. Very cool interior with tree stump seating. Their cookies are also to die for.. Try the cowgirl! Coffee was yummy too.

FiwX3gf2oy4uDnGpswPHQg.text: I'm not a coffee drinker so when everyone else in our group got coffee, I asked for their tea selection.   The staff is super friendly and they recommended the mango black tea for the iced tea.  I'm a big tea drinker and I'm somewhat picky so I was happy to see they do it right. I.e. Brew strong upon order, and chill with a large cup of ice.   The tea was so good that I asked for what the brand of tea was, and they were super helpful.

UJXfJaC0C1rrU2bbmVC45A.text: Employees were very friendly. We were visiting Phoenix and came across them while shopping. Coffee is ground and brewed fresh cup by cup. Lots of college age kids with laptops though taking up the very little seating available, but we managed to find a seat.

FQsNlMlhDpMMuoBWfcYw5A.text: I had the iced chai and it was spectacular. I always try the chai wherever I go and this definitely had a very fresh, distinct taste to it. The employee was working alone so it took a few minutes to get our order (there were 4 of us) but it was well worth the wait.

iFoTH-Z5_Y0Dcqujwrd_Gg.text: Cool atmosphere but I'm not sure I know what's so "lab" about it.  You will pay for that cup of java!  Their largest size in cold drinks is 16oz and 20z for hot drinks.  More and more independent coffee houses are getting away from any size north of 20oz for some odd reason.  A touristy location in the 5th avenue shopping area.

Z4rGQG0ek8_4VqLAPxr5iw.text: The coffee is a bit strong but they have good atmosphere, food and happy hour drinks... making this coffee shop particularly cool.

dDlrPAFdZuIMmgiM2kE4wg.text: Great concept, great service, and amazing coffee. Outdoor patio provides a lounge like experience while the inside has a very humble coffee bar ambiance. Great place to relax and enjoy a drink, now offering beer/wine also.

kgXEeTO77142EHvt_hcE2w.text: Went here today for the first time and boy did this place deliver. This place has a nice vibe when you walk in. They have cool art on the walls nice furniture and they even take your order and have you pay on an I-pad. But the best thing is the COFFEE. I had a Agave with soy (I think that's what it's called) it came with 3 shots of espresso and was Super delicioso! I will be back Screw Starbucks the Cartels moving in on their turf.

W6Nz0WyxJzErajLctWCZOg.text: Quite literally the best cappuccino in Arizona, one of the best I've had in the world.  Just as good as Prufrock in London.  The people of Cartel know and love coffee, and it shows.

VWjPDIzjoprlNZ_zUKlVAQ.text: I love this little place! Delicious coffee (drink and beans.) One of my 3 favorites (Cartel, Stumptown and Lux).  The times I have had food here, it's been great too.   I have had nothing but great service.   My office is moving into this area of town, and I'm very excited I'll be able to walk to Cartel!

NC_7LtrawMWtpqwTmt72YA.text: Obscure microbrews? Weird, edgy music? Barebones furniture? A general warehouse/basement atmosphere? Tatooed baristas with idiosyncratic hats? Awesome coffee? Its got all the hallmarks. Feels just like part of Williamsburg flew to Scottsdale on its parents' credit card. If you need a place to park your MacBook and drink great coffee to fuel those short stories you've been working on for a couple years, this here is the joint.

t9Oqmn2UTx3yB9Gk-i_iXQ.text: A cool coffee shop with beer, what could be better? Well how about serving beer past 10:00 on a Saturday?  Totally stupid operating hours for the bar. Reminds me of of more like a dorm room than a place to go hang out in.

DPM5ZH55GgUUFERumPSuKg.text: This place is pretty nice to hang out, especially in the winter with their patio. They're known for good coffee but have a small selection of beer on tap. Friendly baristas too.

18Xohcr91z4TlriVPorHYQ.text: I'm a big fan of cartel but the fact that this one is not usually as packed as the other location (in Tempe) makes it even sweeter!  I don't do dairy so I'm usually worried when it comes to snazzy drinks but here, they more than meet expectations! I came in with an open mind after biking half the greenbelt last week- pretty much just wanted something cold and tasty- and sort of meekly asked for any suggestions that would fit the "but, yeah, um... no dairy, hahaha...thank you, sorry" (I'm pretty much the awkward penguin meme) criteria, and the barista suggested an iced chai latte with soymilk. And then the fireworks happened. Every person who enjoys chai.... this is by far one of the best I've ever had. It's nice and smooth with just the right amount of that black tea/spice nirvana. Yum!!! Came back today for another one and they remembered me! It's kind of silly, but I was like, yes! That was me thank you! :) I always appreciate when they do that. Oh, just in case anyone was curious- I picked my hetero life mate up a regular one - w/milk (and he is a big ol' coffee snob) and he loved it!

uSMaqi0YqqlRJahrjMLytw.text: Decor charming yet modern. Atmosphere best described as chill. Register is an iPad so no paper used for receipts. Drinks served in glass so no waste there. The iced mocha was delicious and had a light and slightly creamy taste. Friends got an agave latte and a hot coffee. Both approved.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced mocha. Delicious.

FcHYNJXDhQVvP65HSn-Pxg.text: I don't want to be a hater or some typical impatient new yorker, but how this place gets such great reviews and remains open is baffling to me. First I gotta say the girl with the bangs was super nice and really cool. My complaint here is that we were on the road and stopped in here to support local coffee shops and wanted a coffee and a quick bite. My buddy got his latte within 5 mins and he was happy. I just ordered a plain black coffee and I'm not exaggerating, I waited 25 mins to get it. I get that they're crafting me a nice cup of Joe and all but 25 mins is nuts. How do they do business in the morning rush?? And not to pile on,  but we ordered a hummus sandwich and a egg and ham sandwich and that took 30 mins to make! They weren't even packed, they were just moving that slow. Forgive me if I'm being too impatient but that is way too long to be waiting for a plain coffee and a sandwich.

Csq-TNUXx9vEqfy0psboNA.text: My daughter and I happened upon this shop when we were in Scottsdale.  Coffee made to order, which was impressive from the start.  My daughter ordered a Chai Tea which tasted great.  If you go for atmosphere and taste, it's worth the trip.

oWjWIvm4Di5TKVmBRAQRRg.text: I usually meet my friend at cartel for coffee. It is definitely a cute little spot in old town. Their coffee is really great also! They make pretty foam leaves on their lattes! I haven't tried their pastry, but they look sooo good! Next time I'll have to try it out! I'll be coming here again sometime soon!

lZ0U9t2wyUYJiANcOxpJfw.text: Doing Specialty Coffee right in the Old Town. So nice to see a place that is putting their foot down and not even offering foo foo corporate nonsense coffee. This is the real deal here. Nice work!

pyb4JvWjHohqyn4HWhZOwA.text: Another great shop. This coffee shop is right in the heart of OT Scottsdale. The coffee is strong, service is great and the environment makes for a productive work session. Check it out.

1vjNvJ40Z6h9e6VTCBcR4g.text: I got a thing for out of this world coffee and "earthy" chicks with a tattoo here and there; therefore, I love the Cartel Coffee Lab. The baristas are phenomenal as well as the vibe and music. The food is surprisingly fresh, yummy and fair priced. There is also a good selection of draft imports. It's a perfect hideaway from the pretentious neighborhood. Wi Fi has never been a problem. It's a 5 star coffee house in my world.

4BMDCdXuEqRbxpPyvmt2DQ.text: What's to say about Cartel?? If you've tried the coffee just once (no cream, no sugar. JUST THE COFFEE. And slurp it!) then you know that it's hands down the best coffee in the valley. Also, it's hipster and crap blah blah.

oIPa_RNJffSskLrFHJjxsw.text: Location in old tow Scottsdale I came here to escape Starbucks and because I like to support smaller chains.  Service was presumptuous-server kept $3 in change for her tip without asking.   Cool look to the place, but the vibe today was like a library full of stressed out freshman during finals week.  No cream or sugar out for customers at a coffee bar? Not all coffee lovers drink it black so that is a bit odd. Cappuccino was good.   I'll try it again, but the first visit didn't impress.

9-UiedVjmE-0VdokK0uB6Q.text: Pretty good coffee and pastries but the service is mediocre and it can take forever because of the way they make their coffee. The place is a little small and they do what they can with what they have but I always feel like I am in someones way when I am waiting for my coffee. Definitely not the place to go for a quick, decently priced coffee. However, if you have time to kill and want to try something new, this is the place for you.

n6O3ST-Enq3c318Fk-Sl4g.text: happy hour lattes are the gift that keep on giving. and the gifts of love, joy, peace, warmth and happiness and energy...and? idk i'm exaggerating.   i've never had a more delicious latte and i'm finding that it's making me a bit high maintenance. i'm the most unsnobby coffee person but maybe i will be one now? the rest of the weekend, evertime i'd get any form of coffee, i'd be like 'it definitely doesn't compare to what i had at cartel'.   which is why i am going to hold off on my review of echo because i am currently insanely biased and unable to give them a fair shot compared to cartel   who is this coffee snob? jk, i'll still go to town on a folgers anyday.

FZmxsRmMJQ0tQM5-ekWOkw.text: Awesome coffee and place to hang out! Coffee is great every time. Decor is really cool too.

Iq8ubAi__eW8YIF5UkH3OQ.text: very disappointed,  went in early in the morning just wanting to sit and in joy a coffee. the coffee was only warm and not all that good. there is no comfortable relaxing place to sit. music was way to loud for that early in the day. i left without drinking my coffee.

lkoFFptWKnHETM1duLMonQ.text: They are really snooty about coffee. When I wanted four shots of espresso in one cup, they refused and gave me four little cups--each with a saucer! One epresso may be enough for a 140-pound hipster, but not for me. Oh, the epresso is THE best so I have to put up with their crap.

IGQnNZ6wOrHZqkvcvZK6zw.text: After going around Old Scottsdale, my dad and I were craving some coffee and ended up finding this place. It was a breath of fresh air after always going to the usual Starbucks. I like Starbucks, but the coffee here has a unique taste to it...even my 6 year old sister loved the coffee here! The ambience of the place is very chill. It's very much "hipster" and "artsy". There are abstract paintings everywhere, and unique pieces of furniture. When I went there, there were many people studying and going on their computers.   I ordered an Agave flavored Iced Latte which was the best! If you're a black coffee drinker like me, this place is amazing. The latte was flavored so it had a bit of sweetness in it, but not too much. Most of the ingredients are organic, so the coffee tasted very refreshing. I think the agave flavoring is what made the drink so unique. I have to go back to get it again, and maybe bring my laptop to relax there.

BHpxKxDND8oxSzuBTV_CMw.text: Delicious mocha! Great place to work a little and relax a little for a bit. Coffee is amazing! They roast there own beans at the Tempe location.

CVUClI52SqJZl7p4n0qtbQ.text: This place is pretty amazing - great coffee, great staff, great atmosphere. It reminds me of the coffee houses I used to hang out at in Berkeley and Boulder, complete with chess players, tatted up patrons, and eclectic music. If Scottsdale is getting too snobby for you drop in here for some escape.

5JAvMzn434Oxmi9nrtMcjw.text: Atmosphere is awesome and coffee good.  Great alternative to my usual Starbucks

fLOS18i68Ms6f9w83RRiDA.text: This is the closest to a New York hipster style coffee shop I've seen in Arizona.  They serve beer too.    Cookie happy hour is pretty cool though.

XiUI4yyNL6WoPQ_jHWCqIw.text: I have been traveling to the Phoenix area somewhat regularly (for both family and business visits) for about 15 years.  The coffee I found there never failed to disappoint, until..... I  visited your Old Town Scottsdale shop this past weekend.  Wow!  Finally there is really good coffee in Arizona!  Your shop is great, and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable.  Your espresso is right up there with the best in Seattle, Portland, and San Francisco.  Congratulations and thank you!

20zPPZ1A7uQ-_v3Z6d38Eg.text: This place is awesome. Everything from the ambiance and the coffee to the ipad credit card signing app makes you feel good about being here. They have an ice-coffee item not on the menu that's already cold coffee, i like to get that. I think its called a totty. Ask for it! Also, the cookies and muffins are great too, definitely not a disappointment.

AVDSfEb_Nr9AzPxb4cfHag.text: Great location and wonderful coffee! !  The atmosphere was also relaxed and a good place to hang out with friends or get some work done.  Enjoy it!!

OfpV88TEU4ug2TOeF8Zrfw.text: This is a nice place that kind of pops out of nowhere in the midst of Old Town Shops. Its real cute inside and has kind of a "im a million miles away from the world" feel. They have good beer choices and a happy hour pricing, sounds nice, I will go back soon.

Aq9l9VQ0apJCYaFwXXbMZQ.text: After living in NYC for 5 years I got spoiled on great coffee and vibey coffee shops. Cartel hits the spot - the best in Scottsdale! If you haven't tried a cortado, stop what you are doing and go get one. I like to sweeten it with a pump of the simple syrup so I'm not a purist but it's hard to beat Cartel's cortados.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cartel = best coffee in Scottadale.

QE83zhDb5wDYSAE3DeDy8A.text: I have been to Cartel twice now- the first time was rather pleasant on a quiet Saturday morning. The coffee was good- definitely different from your mainstream chain coffee shops. The atmosphere was comfortable and I was able to catch up with a friend and relax there.   The second time, I stopped in to purchase some coffee beans as gifts for my out of town relatives, thinking it would be a nice unique and local present. After choosing the type of coffee, my friend and I stood by the counter waiting to be acknowledged by the barista, who was chatting with a friend.   We waited patiently for a greeting or an offer to ring up the coffee. The barista did not acknowledge us or even look our way even after his friend sat down. He started cleaning the bar instead. Finally he asked what he could do for us. I handed him the 3 bags of coffee and he rang me up. He swiped my card, flipped the iPad for me to sign and turned his back on me. I signed and grabbed my card he had tucked into the iPad stand, calling out a thank you. He did not respond and chose to ignore any semblance of a polite customer interaction.   Comparing my two experiences, I would say that your experience probably depends on when you stop in. There seem to be some really great reviews on this place.  Unfortunately for me, my bad experience outweighed my good one and it's just not worth it for me to return and spend my time and money there.   I'm sad that I spend 40 dollars on some coffee beans that I'm rather embarrassed to give to my family, lest they stop in at this location when they are in town next and have a terrible customer service experience that I did.

VUiqLU_dbCml4RGOJc7c3w.text: The perfection, except when I think a new barista girl make my lovely late, the foam was sadly bubbling and the coffee lake of body and flavor... any other day with any barista guy are perfect.

CeA0Y2gDmv54jYxkROQ5AQ.text: Cartel has come to be my absolute favorite coffee shop. This location in particular is my favorite because it is far less crowded than the Tempe location and is open later than the downtown location. The ambience is far less hipster than the other cartels as well, but maybe that's just because it's in old town. Other pluses include the stocked pastry selection, clean restrooms and cool outdoor patio.

NmAjzOb5Mnz1l5DLGiNpqQ.text: When I think of Cartel, I think of home (but with incredible, delicious coffee). Cartel offers the best, top-notch coffee roasted and brewed in the valley...but although the coffee is superb, the people behind the counter make this much more than a place to pick up a latte. The manager, Ben greets me as a best friend every time I come in, and the rest of the staff remembers my past orders, my questions on life, and they genuinely listen every day I walk through the front door.  The setting of Cartel is perfect for good conversations, the music playlist is everything you'd want, and the snacks from Phoenix Public Market are extremely hard to avoid eating (because they're delicious). If you need to get work done, head to the back room where it's quiet and ideal for knocking out a homework or work assignment.  In general, I cannot recommend this place more. Ben, Kiley, and Mark have become friends that I look forward to seeing each time I come in. I buy their beans, make cold brew at home from their instructions, and often come just to sit and hang out. If there was a six star review, I'd give it to them.  Bravo.

kdD-1fbNtV4Ye4Bbgy7X2Q.text: This place is terrific. It has a Delightful staff that appears to be enjoying crafting delicious espresso drinks. One of my favorite cappuccinos with beautiful art :) they also have wonderful selection of great tasting beers! My only disappointment, there isn't a location closer to me

4KJ_-2u0oToDTzdG4z-1Ow.text: Finally, a coffee place you can brag about going to. Cartel is an intelligent coffee shop with trendy decor and knowledgeable baristas. I feel good about being there, like I've chosen wisely for not going to a run-of-the-mill coffee-bucks type establishment. Though I sometimes feel out of my element because I don't know a lot about coffee, I've always been treated with courteous and attentive customer service. By the way, major bonus points for using an iPad to place orders and being able to text or email you the receipt. Why don't more places do that? The Espresso is strong with a solid kick and does the trick. I like how they serve it in a mug instead of a paper cup. The Chai Latte is also phenomenal. As good, if not better than ones I've had elsewhere. I'm impressed by the various coffee beans and accessories they offer too. I even purchased the Aeropress so I can make coffee like them (and because of the great reviews: amazon.com/Aerobie-AeroP...). *Be sure to buy it from the store, though* Looking forward to trying out their food and BEER selections soon. But, even if they only served coffee, I'd be more than happy. Definitely check out their Tempe location for a very hipster hole-in-the-wall ambiance that reminds me of drinking coffee in a place like Chicago or NYC: yelp.com/biz/cartel-coff...

MdOK0fqNIcYSDM45Vw8KJQ.text: Best espressp I've had in awhile. Love how knowledgable the staff is.

S97r29fH2FWCJf7F95HsPA.text: Nerd Out on Coffee in this joint, I haven't had a decent espresso since I left home. This place hits every spot, local, hip, excellent beans, Weezer on the background, local art, and baristas that actually give a dam about their craft.

eOg0BnYiV6wrWIHJoNgYsg.text: Cartel is a great Phoenix cup of coffee. I have to admit, when you're in NYC, SF, LA, in particular-- you're exposed to some of the best coffee in the world.  When you're in Phoenix, however; Cartel is a quite decent local roastery. My go-to drink is a Gibraltar. If you have a palate for smooth espresso and you're able to diffentiate quality from garbage.... you will appreciate this place :) Ambiance is great too at all locations. I'm not giving it 5 starts because their restrooms are horrendous. Regardless of gender, I prefer Male & Female restrooms to be separate. Men simply are not as clean as women when it comes to restroom cleanliness. I honestly think they would draw in more people and have even more repeat customers if they invested in revamping the restrooms at both the Tempe & Scottsdale locations.

Fjto_4wvMvNGeEEXyHIKyA.text: The best espresso I've had so far.   I purchase my coffee here as well. It's always delicious, never bitter and of very high quality.  This coffee shop is my all time fav. I hope they stay open indefinitely. If you are in the area try them out. They have beer too!

BFzVgnzVuq2fnNlR07CqiA.text: Eat this if you visit! Pop Day Tarts  just try not to inhale it like I did  worth savoring every flaky bite  and oh yeah, serious coffee

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pop Day Tarts!

ffcuhBJaxbFNMqWuGmvrSg.text: Damn....  Another great coffee shop.  Coffee Or  coffee Sorry to my frilly friends...  No frappienilladecofnotcoff drinks.  Really nice coffee in a small hip place.  AND  They serve beer.   Perfect

9vYBiuCa186rKevyUG8GWQ.text: hands-down the best coffee in the Greater Phoenix area.  Passionate baristas that know their products. A commitment to quality. A great space for getting things done. I plugged in the headphones and spent a solid 5 hours here one afternoon. Had a great conversation as I was visiting from another shop in Columbus, Ohio.... This is my top recommendation in all of PHX.

Vgeb6O639KiOHyiU8eO9CQ.text: I just wanted to add that they've added snacks to the menu. My next visit was better!

7wzdrRca2ZCfOqyLgThz-w.text: Hands down the best pour over coffee I've had to date. I just returned from Costa Rica and the coffee was good, but I also learned on a coffee tour the best coffee is exported. Leaving a great sub par coffee for domestic consumption. The flavor profile of the coffee cartel is so complex. Subtle undertones of honey or vanilla, orange effervescence( depending on what they have and what you choose). James is my go to hit here. Super cool, chill and knowledgable. He remembers your name too. Please drink it black, adding anything will ruin the brew in my opinion.  They have an amazing cold brew as well and fresh top notch pastries. Try the pop tart. If you're a local or a tourist stop by cartel, grab a pour over coffee, a pop tart and take 30 min to appreciate life how good it truly is. When you're recharged go try and spread the good vibes by helping another!

nPLRh4Q57DRc_0iis39Pgw.text: I was feeling a bit slumpy on a Sunday afternoon. And as a California native who recently moved out here, I'm definitely still acclimating to the bone-dry Arizona climate. The heat really taxes me, especially when I'm already in a mental fog.  Anywayzies, I was perusing the streets of downtown Scottsdale with a friend was visiting for the holiday weekend. We both needed a pick-me-up and a task to kill a bit of time, so we decided to hunt down a caffeinated solution. Starbucks is great, but there are a ton of great alternative coffee spots in Arizona. Luckily, my Yelp search results fed me Cartel and I'm pleased to announce that I have found a new go-to coffeehouse.   My order: an iced vanilla latte with 4 shots. Wow! There is definitely something extraordinarily invigorating about the coffee beans Cartel harnesses. With every sip, I gradually regained pep. The next thing I knew, I was bopping and singing along to a Spotify track in my friend's car.   That said, I don't recommend 4 shots if you're already kind of awake. I think next time I'll level down to 2 shots if I'm already primed from some sort of caffeine intake earlier that day.  I also have to say that atmosphere-wise, the charm and comfort level of this place is incredible. With plenty of space, as well as couches, chairs and tables spread out amongst 2 rooms, this abode is an ideal spot for hosting a wide variety of scenarios; from a dynamic conversation between friends, to a great first-time meeting spot for a Tindr rendezvous, to a study haven for a last-minute cramming session.

JOVaMF5e84e33ZTLK5nuqg.text: Great coffee shop vibe with super delicious and fresh coffee. They have five different roasts and I got a cup of the fruity blend from El Salvador.  They really know their coffee and can explain all the subtleties of the different varieties.    I have to say that everything from here seemed to be made with an abundance of love.  I loved watching my coffee being made as the woman oh so thoughtfully poured water through the paper filter so that the coffee was nothing less than perfect.     In addition to their great coffee, they also have delicious yogurt and granola with fresh strawberries and honey.  They also have a selection of delicious quiches and scones.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

46jpeCbSGCvsmB2GbW4rzg.text: Fantastic coffee. Super friendly service, without pretentiousness. They get busy!  Try the poptart... Tasty!

1Ui6J7Uv-ASUNvgXJ-4Y7Q.text: Guatemalan Coffee. Awesome food. Great Atmosphere....  If you are a coffee connoisseur.. like i claim to be.. then this place is definitely for you. The coffee is brewed to perfection and the ambiance is great. I've been here several times, just to stop by for coffee or to sit and talk with some friends. If you find a nice table it is also a great study spot!

WJFOZSk7NoEG9hD4Y_ldTQ.text: Best iced dirty chai tea latte with a shot of espresso and almond milk is AMAZING!!!!

NmgiCN8He_dyXc3TuyX9Dg.text: My partner and I were in Old Town Scottsdale and dropped by for a much needed coffee before heading out to explore.  The 'Lab' or cafe itself is very sweet and different, but the menus behind the counter were very basic and didn't specify any of their specialty drinks that I have seen other Yelpers order, so I had to ask a lot of questions.   The guys behind the counter weren't the friendliest - maybe their patience was running thin on all the questions I was asking! They weren't busy at all, so it would have been nice to have felt more welcome.  I was interested in looking at the merch and coffee products they were selling inside, however most of the shelves were nearly empty and nothing replenished, so I just took the coffees and headed straight out.  I ordered the vanilla latte and my partner, the cappuccino. Nice coffees, rich in flavour, but I wouldn't make a special trip for their product.  If in the area, give it a try. Although if you want to try anything other than a regular americano or latte, be prepared to ask questions!

52aLye12-11WLimi-cc6CQ.text: Great coffee, however they need to offer sugar and quality sugar!  No sugar, just syrup!

I9zww8nzymmIlIUAxuorvg.text: My iced latte was good. But the price for iced coffee does not exist on the menu board.  I paid $5.75 for a large iced latte which is way too high.  Be clear about your price on the menu!!

z3gziW3MIif1BMqdJMC70A.text: Expensive but well worth it cool atmosphere and amazing coffee it's a must the dirty chai amazing!!

sXdsC_4bT-1atDEGtCP-Hw.text: Cute coffee shop in old town Scottsdale. Service was quick and friendly. Went with a latte. I wanted coconut milk but they only have almond and oat milk so I decided to try something new and did the oat milk. It was actually really good! Super smooth and creamy. My friend went with a vanilla cold brew and it was delicious! Interior is kinda small and cold--many community tables with an industrial urban kind of vibe. Nothing wrong with it but just not very warm and cozy so I likely wouldn't pop in here to get any work done. For a grab and go situation though it's perfect!

D4MuccW6H4foES6UggqmTQ.text: I spent years somehow not stopping in Cartel, and finally broke down to check it out. It has such a great atmosphere! I was there to catch up with a friend but plenty of people were working, meeting with big groups, or just popping in to grab a quick coffee.   I was really excited about the build your own coffee with their three different brew methods - Chemex pour over 20oz, V60 drip in 12oz or 16oz, and AeroPress for 8 oz. On top of all these brew methods they had 6 different coffee beans to choose from. I had the Chemex of the Nyeri Hill coffee. They were busy so it took about 15 minutes for us to get it, and they served our coffee to us in a glass carafe that was way too hot to handle. Once I made my friend beat the burden of pouring the coffee, I wasn't blown away by the flavor. But I will say the description of "intense blood orange and pomegranate" is no lie. At other coffee shops I've had plenty of roasts claiming flavor where there really is only one if you use your imagination - Cartel was not at all like that.   In addition to this they had everything else you'd expect from a coffee shop, plus some beer taps, plus a wall of merch, plus a location that's perfect to grab a cup of coffee to go and stroll through shops.   Definitely worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chemex coffee served in a super hot carafe. So instagrammable!

iweCk9ixYccqrwpm5n7A0w.text: Roasted: first coffee stop in Arizona in Scottsdale. It's a cute little coffee shop in a strip plaza. I like the ambiance and layout of the coffee shop - good mellow music and decent seating. The coffee shop is clean and we were greeted upon entering. The employees were friendly and I appreciate that. The roast their coffee locally and have a lot of offerings including cold brew on tap. We were not offered for here mugs although everyone else in the shop had one. Kinda felt like because they didn't know us - they just gave us to go cups. The latte art was beautiful on mine with a big white heart. They don't offer sugar free flavors here and the although the milk was creamy - I needed to add some sugar to offset the espresso which I wasn't the biggest fan off. The shots were pulled right - it just wasn't the full bodied espresso I typically like. I am relatively neutral regarding this place on whether I'd come back or not.   Unroasted: nice decor but does not all make sense.   I like the seating but I always miss seeing a big comfy couch or loveseat.    I do like the poster on wall to add a pin of where you are coming from.    Love the look of the clean menu.   The staff was nice and greeted properly.  They did not ask if it was for here or to go.  I always prefer drinking out of mug.   They did a nice job with the latte it looked great but no sugar free options.    I was able to drink my coffee but not my favorite.    I really wanted to like this place but it fell short.  Ps added sugar

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
