YpqTtKlUerkv0XuLsnYKdQ.text: long wait.   and this coffee is terribleeee. i dont know why it tasted so bitter.

7MxcKHTnBTP0eKCSD_dVdw.text: The best coffee in the valley, hands down.  Even their simple drip is phenomenal.  The staff, however, is always miserable.  A simple smile goes a long way, especially with the obligatory "do you want to tip" on the POS screen.  Gotta love the one girl that doesn't even ask what she can get you, but rather just stares at you until you proceed to order.  One day, I'll accept her challenge and stare in silence right back.  We'll be there for a while.  Or the other, that's so hip that she can only vocal fry "yeeeaaah" at you after telling her thank you.  Seriously though, cheer up!

pCzoE6KMhtwxhQJPzJyCgg.text: Not the best place to study but maybe to grab a quick drink!   If your looking for a place with outlets to charge your computer, this is not the best place there are a few spots to charge your laptop but not everywhere.. they do have outlets to plug in your phone to charge.   The place doesn't feel super cozy, but industrial decor never feels real cozy to me!   I had the cortado with almond milk which I don't recommend, my boyfriend had the cortado with regular milk though and it tasted fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YG-YOJnCNLH_g9WbW4Crow.text: First of all, this was the only coffee shop in the area open on thanksgiving day! So I'm very grateful they were open until 1pm! Cartel is located in the 5th avenue shops area. When I first walked in, I noticed the ample seating and warm environment! There were high top tables with bar stools, multiple long tables, and cushioned seats along the wall. There is also an outdoor seating area with smaller tables and a couch! So lots of space to choose from! I saw multiple people on their laptops so looks like a great work environment or fun place to catch up with a friend. We ordered a chai tea latte and a one and one. The one on one came in 3 small cups with: 1. espresso 2. espresso with milk and 3. soda? The espresso was delicious, bold, and strong. The chai tea latte was also delicious but a tad too sweet for my liking. There are lots of coffee options to choose from so I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One on one: espresso with + without milk

evwyoIQX03CCZJ9Mgw2Xpw.text: Mmmmm. Rich frothy crema on top of my espresso drink with a pretty design!  Service was friendly and very accommodating. They carried out our order and anticipated our needs, bringing dishes and extra utensils. Super cool environment with inside and out seating, wifi was free and restrooms were clean and easily accessible.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Q7H6EUKHTfm5vWE5VlM3Xw.text: The roast I had was delicious and I'd stop back here.  Liked the atmosphere as well, spacious and options for seating.  I was however looking for a French press and given the menu size maybe the concept is to be focused.  I tried the pour over, should've gotten a second cup.

KIVvYoiyd8KmlN2rmWFL1w.text: Coffee is really good. They have a handful of brews. Cappuccino is a little more like a latte but tastes awesome. Comfortable seating, seating with tables and bar seating.  We walked up just as 4 or 5 other people were ordering and it was a little chaotic but nothing that would detract me from coming back...just kept me from giving 5 stars.

BtaTtHroNEIa49MIZDTkow.text: Can't even call one of these locations. I have questions that I want answered BEFORE I go to their place and all they did was have a voice recording telling me to email them.  Yeah... that ain't gonna happen. Hard pass on a company that has 6 locations but none will answer a dang phone call.

-C9EhtL5wfzAXQ8JvbgpHA.text: Great local coffee shop chain! I've never experienced a coffee bar like this before as their are so many creative things you can try. I had an iced agave latte and it was delicious! The staff was friendly and very communicative. The atmosphere is pleasant but the chairs are super uncomfortable which is why I gave four stars, but everything else about Cartel is great! Will be back!  Please check out my collection: "The Valley's Best Coffee Shops + Houses," on my profile; featuring Cartel Coffee Lab and other amazing Coffee Shops in Phoenix!

zisOJ_m_RIsTaxWm5tjGXw.text: Iced Agave Latte #lit Nice chill environment, excellent service and a knowledgeable staff. This is my first time to a Scottsdale coffee shop and I am not disappointed at all.

du_0mXuMhIONke1afRYTTw.text: Yum. Coffee so good, so fresh, so darn yummy!! I really enjoyed my cup of black! I really enjoy the atmosphere here too. Thanks for a wonderful morning of coffee goodness.

WBE41maV3A2IpeO7I1Uzwg.text: Get the cold brew. Get the cold brew.  I was in Scottsdale for 4 days and each day, I went to get one. I heard it was worth it and it was. Refreshing and very tasty! There is a location in Old Town Scottsdale and there is plenty of parking nearby. Lots of shops to browse around after you get your cold brew or americano (husbands favorite). If I lived in Arizona, I would be there all the time!

XSoJ1RVAMYDMJ4lAJsS78g.text: Really nice and cozy environment with friendly staff and great house music. Sat here awhile to stay out of the heat. Oh yeah, a great Cup of Joe too!

oIOs3RXgLeAEc5iQOTVexw.text: Great coffee and space. I may have just caught them on a bad day, but the staff is not super friendly and makes you feel like an idiot if you are not a coffee snob.

FwRbyAwmZ_8t567sIpYd1Q.text: Please stop it with the attitude. I asked for an "iced coffee" and barista said:  "do you mean iced toddy?" Umm..sure whatever. Just get me some caffeine with iced over it.   Oh and don't ask for skim milk if you don't want a lecture.   I used to go here often since I like supporting small businesses but now with all the new coffee shops opening up in the area I will be supporting them instead.

2-epuRd7GF14MnWcNARN_g.text: Very nice selection of gourmet coffee. For the coffee snobs. No garbage syrups added here. Educate yourself on coffee, then give this place a review. Highly recommended!

ggvqbxMzG-Co9KCPac8-3w.text: Amenamy - Purity Ring (Jon Hopkins remix) CHVRCHES - Mother Blackmill - Let It Be  Any place with a playlist like this and repurposed anything in this city merits attention. I don't really find a lot of places in Scottsdale that parallel my mood that often, but this cafe brings a touch of Alfred's/Intelli/BlueBottle to the area. Maybe even Philz since this is one of the few places with azn kids in the desert.  Coffee-wise, pretty comparable and yummy. Almond milk latte, dirty chais are yummy. The crowd is mixed and interesting. Favorite chill spot in the area, although it makes me emo hearing a track every 15 minutes from a band that I can't see live here. At least we got Jamie XX.

3ItUuWLRTzuSBu48K6rXbA.text: One star for being local, hip, serving beer on tap, and having a cool ambiance. But as far as espresso goes. EEEK! If my Americano hadn't cost $4, I would have thrown it in the trash (most sour, bitter, disgusting espresso I've ever tasted). And I wanted to love this place - took a trip to Old Town just for them. So sad.   P.S. Not to sound pretentious but rather to establish some credibility: as a born-and-raised Seattleite who's been drinking espresso everywhere since I was 12 in dozens of states and a few different countries, I know a bit about how good espresso should taste. This is not it.

j9tx3VsMBevFrfOpIJT3OQ.text: Always seeking good espresso when traveling and Cartel was worth seeking out.   Friendly staff and smooth cortado!  Worth checking out if in Old Town.

u8J0mS3W6J3qvGQ7f_IBag.text: Great wifi. Not crowded. Plenty of seating. Very hipster place nestled in the heart of old town scottsdsle. Never even knew it was there but the chai tea was top notch! So delicious and lots of yummy cutely decorated foam on top $6 for a large plus $1 tip

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chai

oNpun-Sx2bTmte7XIqhrsA.text: The best non-Scottsdale in Scottsdale!  The decor, as with the other location, is a bit "industrial."  That is, long wooden tables a la picnic tables provide most of the work space, and it feels like a hipster classroom at times with everyone on their MacBooks.  However, this is not necessarily a negative, especially given some of the options in this part of town.  Outside space is very nice.  But most importantly:  The coffee and teas are awesome, brewed to order, and the staff is wonderful.  The music is always great, but bring headphones in case the music doesn't match your current needs...it's hard to focus on "work" when the music and people watching are so awesome...  Same great coffee and staff as the Tempe location. The best.

qGGZiXZB4FGrPRBZnigFtQ.text: Watching them make the coffee is what made me give them 5 stars.   The atmosphere is very laid back with a very cozy kind of layout. The people are very nice and the cappuccino is definitely on point. You can't take it to go bc of the art of the foam made on top and I think that is amazing. This place is truly a great coffee shop and this is their second location I found out and hopefully they will keep adding more. It's great and will definitely come back every chance I get back in Arizona

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The cappuccino! Amazing! Art!

MVQC_isYfxPwa0Nl9vgmRw.text: Very cute area and place.  Cleverly designed.  Nice staff.  Cool, hip vibe.  Good chocolate chip cookie.  But, the main reason for my visit was to have my favorite drink I test everywhere - the mocha.  Unfortunately, it disappointed.  A bit bitter, not a smooth mocha.  It was actually the 3rd bad mocha I got trying different independent cafes in the Phoenix area over my vacation.  Maybe Phoenix just isn't a mocha town.  I'd probably go back and try a different drink.

ombg1X2PZNVPtMTUyXcQbQ.text: The service was impeccable and the atmosphere just what we were looking for as we strolled through the Waterfront with our puppy.

VWlgaax7Dtm_Z_tBP0RITw.text: My morning coffee is a must. Thankfully, Cartel is conveniently located near the office and hotels when I'm up in Scottsdale for work. This particular location, as mentioned before is a little snug compared to the stores we have in Tucson, but I like the coziness. Their no "to go cappuccino" policy is my only quibble. I totally get that they don't want to compromise the quality of their coffee with to go orders, but sometimes the customer needs it to go! Most importantly though, it's how the staff delivers the news. I appreciate the clever barista that was able to accommodate my Cortado order in a To go cup, how? He was creative

08-BZRtOKxrAwUjXxYt6qg.text: Such a wonderful place! The barista was a ball of love. He was the best, he was basically an artist in the little coffee mug. My coffee was so refreshing and delicious.  Everyone should check this gem out.

TCz4H4ZmnyedZkjDGFYGZA.text: Went here once. The employees were either stoned, hungover, or nauseated by my presence. 2/3 or all three wouldn't have surprised me, either.   While waiting for my drink I perused their bookshelf and came across a copy of Dianetics.   Really none of the above bothered me. I just didn't care much for the coffee.

4CyJ-VzaAFh1HqHCkY9SHA.text: Very relaxing and had just what everyone wanted on a warm afternoon. Coffee  or good beer you choose!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

A4jBYP4t_NXyDo1--1osnQ.text: A cool, industrial space with an emphasis on reclaimed wood and metal in a section of Old Town dedicated to touristy gift shops and jewelry stores.  The staff here are meticulous about their coffee and take the upmost care when preparing your hot, caffeinated elixir.  Ordering a cup here is not without a series of decisions to make.  First you have to pick from a dizzying list of single origin beans.   Next, you define your preferred brewing method, which include Aeropress, Hario, Chemex or Clever.  Then sit back and wait as they work their magic.  Truly great coffee, and this is coming from someone who has access to the very best in SF.

OLp7YxlXf0XY63fuUV2EBw.text: I was in Phoenix for work for a couple of days and stayed in a hotel in Scottsdale and my coworker took me to this place so we could do some work in between meetings.   I loved the coffee. It had good flavor and it wasn't too strong. I also tried their iced teas and some pastries.   I loved the bookcase at the front!   and I loved the little room in the back where I could sit and work without being bothered.

AMwg1wFJn2einKJoCOlzzA.text: Very good coffee. Interestingly the brewed coffee is a lighter roast.  I asked why light and they replayed that use lots of beans to get the flavor and not cover flavor with a dark roast.  Interesting and a concept I am going to try.

DwrnxqPMeuEWgKDK2dlAFQ.text: Soooo much better than Starbucks! The menu is relatively small which makes it much more pleasurable to place an order since it's not as overwhelming.    We tried both the iced vanilla latte and the iced agave latte. Both were excellent with a wonderful coffee flavor that went well with the slight sweetness of both the vanilla and the agave. I can't drink lattes at Starbucks, they're always way too sweet but I sure can at Cartel!  Fun, funky environment and really nice employees.

LvfNadrW3JKfsWRqZfILnQ.text: Cartel always has a good vibe and good music! I like that they opens late. I can go anytime I want. I love their baked goods. They are delicious.   I really like this convenient location. I can choose to sit inside or outside. It is busy during a certain time of day but not all the times, which is good because I can have less busy atmosphere to enjoy the drink and relax.

9-_bZ-EAD--PNW7Zu-oyzg.text: Update: they no longer serve the homemade pop tarts here. Sad  Coffee is great and the baked goods are well done. This place has tables in every nook and cranny which is perfect for studying.

nxSAMMBVjRVwAbe4wUfEiQ.text: In Oldtown Scottsdale. Open before most of the other stores. I had a Chai latte for $4.25. Pricy, but I guess I'm paying for the location. You could get it hot or iced. Iced will probably get you less of it since they pile up the ice. The tea was sweetened already, but the sweetness wasn't overpowering.   They don't have designated parking, but there is minimal store front parking. If you go early, you won't have a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chai latte

0pFOp6VaF2YlrGdFToGO-w.text: Great coffee here. I got an iced latte and the flavor was rich and pleasant.   However, I did not have a positive experience here. I went in on a hot Sunday afternoon, thirsty for a cold refreshing beverage. There were many students hard at work on their laptop with their notebooks spread across the spacious tables. Fortunately there wasn't a line at the register. I was able to ordered my coffee immediately but didn't receive an order number nor did they take note of my name. I took a seat at a nearby table and patiently waited for my drink. After a few minutes of waiting, I glanced at the barista and saw her talking with a young women over the counter. A customer? Maybe a friend? I didn't think much of it.   By now, nearly 15 minutes had gone by and the barista finally finishes her all-important talk and hastily fills the machine with coffee beans to make my drink. In less than a minute, my drink was ready and she calls out "iced latte." There was no eye contact, no acknowledgement, and no apologies about the wait as I approached to get my drink. I'm by no means entitled or picky when it comes to service. I waited patiently for my drink because who knows what the context of the situation is. But my experience here left me disappointed. The care and attention I received here was nonexistent.

z2DnAcq2-ETkI8q2unY-fA.text: I happened to be on vacation and we were walking on a little strip and came across this location. The smell inside was exhilarating and awakened your senses. They had a variety of options including teas. I settled for the basic coffee americano. It was just as good as it smelled the barista was very patient considering we didn't know what we really wanted.  She also offered suggestions which helped us. They had inside and a sort of outside seating arrangement. It could get a little to hot for outside sitting so we sat inside but within a few minutes the place started getting packed. They also had specialty items for sale. This place seems to be a very hip place to go for surrounding neighborhood. Looking forward to coming back and visiting.

9ZM-XbVBmo_LvaNnbtcRyQ.text: My husband and I went here for a break and for some coffee after a day trip on his bike.   Not sure if I ordered the wrong item or if that's how they serve!  Love the ambience but at the same time disliked their coffee. Service was quick on a Sunday evening. Decided to order the iced mocha which was bitter for my taste. Took it up to the barista who added some sugar to fix it.   I still couldn't manage to finish my drink!

yvYsRLedoq8XcoHvuPWKoA.text: Great place to pop in! We were glad to find a local coffee shop on our way out of town! I had a vanilla latte with oat milk and my husband got an iced americano. It is a really cool space with lots of seating! I wish we could have stayed to enjoy more of soaking in the vibe but we were pretty quick on our short visit!

HW-y_LuMr9sMJNpNkXMd4Q.text: My husband and I stopped by Cartel on our way out of Scottsdale.  It was on a Main Street that had a small town feel, even though it was in the downtown area of Scottsdale.    It's a small shop that shares seating and restrooms with the other shops next to it so it feels bigger than it is.    The baristas were friendly and made a killer iced vanilla latte for my husband and a cold brew with a splash of cream for me.  We also picked up a couple of bags of beans, which we just finished up tonight.  The decaf is what we have at night and quite good.  Their roasts are smooth, not bitter and delicious.

hkDJQsz8aOC0hirS3Oc7Yw.text: Iced Mocha - Yummm!  I should've gotten the large, because (as you can see) I couldn't resist drinking almost all of this before I could snap a photo.   I went with a friend this afternoon, and I'm not usually a "coffee drinker" much less espresso. I was just imagining myself buzzing all night, as I was scanning the vast (I mean extensive and unique choices).  My eyes kept locking on "chocolate," haha, so I ordered the Iced Mocha, but thought I'd only really want a little.   Big mistake; I drank this thing down like it was a mini chocolate milkshake.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small Iced Mocha - Yummy! I recommend a large! :)

ReVOJSf9-ykf1G5b7kV-5w.text: First time I have ever returned a coffee that I did not like and actually have the barista charge me for a replacement. Rolled my eyes and paid for it because I really needed the late afternoon pick me up.   Wanted to patronize a local shop over a Starbucks, but honestly it backfires at this Cartel Coffee location. Rude, rude, rude.   I initially ordered an agave latte (first time) and asked about the sweetness level. The barista was pretty aloof and uppity and he wasn't much help in determining if this latte would be very good. So I asked for them to go very light on the agave.   Turns out no one was listening and I received an overly sickening sweet latte with a bad pull of espresso.   This is the second location we have been to with zero luck on the coffee and especially the horrible service. Just another uncaring, dirty little hipster coffee spot that really can't be bothered to serve the community at even a basic level of customer service.   It's in a really cute shopping area, but I highly encourage you to skip this place. Won't be back, and will be sure to let my coworkers and local friends know about the crappy experience here. Lame.

JINrzWxprHbtClzo5gEd7g.text: Cartel Coffee Lab is exactly the kind of place you hope to find while wandering. You know what I mean, it's early on a weekend morning, you're wandering around Old Town, doing a little window shopping before the stores open, pretending you're on a "walk", and suddenly this cute, local, hip, coffee shop appears before you.   Cartel has lots of drink options - coffees (obviously), teas and even beer, along with a good selection of pastries. It has a modern/industrial feel, with both indoor and outdoor seating. It's the kind of place you would read a newspaper on a Sunday morning, if anyone actually did that any more. More likely, it's a place to kick back, enjoy your drink and scroll through Instagram posts on your phone, wishing your life was so nicely curated.   I had an iced vanilla latte with oat milk, which I'd never tried before. The barista said oat milk was her favorite, so I took her word for it. I liked it! We also had an iced tea and the salted brownie cookie. The cookies were a free treat for moms on Mother's Day, which was really sweet (get it? sweet? Is this thing on?)  I've read some of the other reviews and I didn't find the coffee to be overly bitter, but I do like a strong roast (I like Starbucks, so sue me). I would definitely go back on a weekend morning to have a caffeinated beverage and hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced latte, iced tea and salted brownie cookie.
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eYferS6-iPNXcaKKV-IT2Q.text: I've been a huge Cartel fan ever since I tried it for the first time near ASU's Tempe campus. Something about the smell and ambiance that hits you when you first walk in is a little but magical.   Cafe Ambiance: -They always play the COOLEST music and it's just loud enough to drown out conversations around you so you can actually be productive if that's the purpose of your visit -lots of seating and work space with outlets all around and just enough natural light -the smell of coffee roasting is truly intoxicating and it's one of my favorite things about Cartel  Drinks and pastries: -I ordered my usual dirty chai, but this time with Oat milk! I love the oat milk in the chai, I think it's much smoother than almond milk, but my mom ordered a regular latte with oat milk and was not a fan, so I would say to proceed with caution with this option. Maybe stick to soy or almond which are their other dairy alternatives if you aren't sure about oat milk -we tried the golden milk snickerdoodle today and it was AMAZING! It has a spicy flavor profile with a sweet and slightly tart (lemony?) glaze drizzle on top which complimented the spicy flavor very well  Overall, I love Cartel and I will obviously be back for more of their dirty chai!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8nC-QOAav3biViRregazug.text: Yum!! Cool atmosphere and great coffee! I got an iced oat milk mocha and it was very refreshing and delicious. There were a few people with laptops doing work. Other than that it wasn't very crowded. Reasonable price.

Prices are a bit steep. $5.50 for a large drip. And their beans range from $15-$20 for 12oz which is typical but still on the higher end.  Oh but they're coffee is delicious. I had the higher end drip which was a Guatemalan.

h9LzBti6y0viYooLvEbRMg.text: This coffee is a bomb! They also do a great latte art, even in paper cups.  Had a cheesecake muffin that was not overly sweet and delicious.

sqM7RV_r-DBAQD5fzt1h-g.text: Freshly roasted beans are sold here. We got a macchiato and vanilla latte seriously best coffee I ever had. Cool vibe,lots of seating and not a bad wait at all for our coffees

7_HP9NbSj3Jr6A2QRi_gKA.text: My friend suggested this place so we stopped by after our shopping at Fashion Square.  LOCATION- its in an area where there is small boutiques. There isnt a lot of parking spots but we were able to find one!   SERVICE-typical hipster coffee employee attitude. Told the barista it was our first time and she just said ok.    ICED VANILLA LATTE- it was just okay. I have to say I liked it better than Press Coffee but I just wasnt impressed.  ICED MOCHA- my friend had this and i took a sip of it and let me tell you, it was very bitter. Something about the concoction wasnt right. She didnt even touch it after two sips. What a waste of money.  The place doesnt get a lot of sunlight but there are tables where you can sit down to chat or study. I would not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. LARGE ICED VANILLA LATTE

uOCxOlooMuRUUW6SX0-KoA.text: Coffee: 5/5 Service: 4/5 Ambiance: Casual, hipster, trendy Coffee: Superb! This is an upscale coffee spot with some great selections all over the world. El Salvador, Guatemala, Kenya, Mexico... the list goes on! Prices start at $2.50 and go to $6.50 for a pour-over. They've got some great teas ($3.75-$4.25), Espresso for $2.50, Macchiato $3.75, Cortado for $3.75, Cappuccino for $3.75, Americano for $3.50, Lattes for $4, Mocha for $4.50, Chai's for $4.00, Cold Brew for $3.00. Treats: I've only had their coffee cake (bomb.com) but their muffins and caramel bars look legit! Treats range from $2-3, can't go wrong if your sweet tooth is kicking in. Overall experience: Love this place for a quick stop for coffee to go, or sitting down for a couple hours to do some work. You'll always find people working on their computers or just hanging out. Never too loud, and it's in the heart of Old Town. Great location, and great shopping next door! Happy Hour Thursday's! 4pm-close $2 off all beer & wine $3 cans of beer (All featuring local breweries & wineries!)

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HTNX9VsDFDoYsX26Up1UMw.text: Last day in Scottsdale and I needed a great cup of coffee. I asked the barrista to choose a medium roast for a 16 ounce chemex. The choice she made was very delicious.  The coffee was well balanced and had just the amount of body so I could enjoyably sip the entire 16 ounce pot without it cooling too fast.  The vibe is super chill. Quiet enough to crank out some tasks if you're working from home. Loud enough to enjoy a conversation with a friend without offending your closest neighbor.  Thank you Cartel

v5TTrgC3FmGp3qg-MRmATQ.text: Absolutely killer place. Excellent cortado during our last visit to town. Followed by a nice macchiato today. Great music and atmosphere. Well worth the visit for the rest of the out of towners wondering where their best opportunity for exceptional espresso and espresso based drinks can be found. Small but awesome beer selection on tap and limited wines too. Glad they stop there though. No one can be the jack of all.

gacwEd67Shqlc1CbYyWWlA.text: Dropped by tonight for an Americano....not good!  I had high expectations, but this was the worst Americano I've ever tried.  Don't waste your time on this place.  I would rather spend the time driving over to Lux for some quality espresso.

OFD16mhSWndbiW2b217A0Q.text: I can't say that I'm impressed by this coffee shop's attitude nor their roasting ability. Back when they first opened in Tempe it was a totally different experience. I used to get Cartel Coffee whole beans regularly, but then I moved away for a period of time. I thought I'd give them a try again as they used to roast pretty good coffee. Well times have changed and they seem to be under the impression that under roasting coffee is a good thing. I purchased 2 12oz bags of beans at $19 for 12oz thinking it was a full 16oz. I guess 12oz is because they are "ultra premium". I took the coffee home and made espresso. The beans gave off a good aroma as it brewed, but the flavor was terrible. Overly sour and acidic in a bad way. The beans were under roasted and also had an inconsistent roast. some beans were almost a light tan color while others were a deeper tan, but none were a full roast. I contacted the shop thru yelp prior to making this review and the owner responded with a diatribe on how I just didn't understand how coffee is made and they'd be happy to educate me the next time I was in. I was told that things I disliked were actually positives. Over all I was treated like I was stupid for even suggesting there was something wrong with their coffee. Not a positive experience and I won't go back. I'd recommend Coffee Rush for a much better customer experience.

THNxjsEPQQixIdI7iNs6aQ.text: Cartel is my favorite spot around. It's clean and the quality of coffee is superior.

mbUH_7tS6YtK9P3YxKa8cg.text: Coffee isn't hot enough. Nice little place, funky vibe

avR3-edkMXY-0pO_txj95w.text: I love Cartel. So I have been there multiple times. Love their coffee and pastries. Love love the environment, so non-cheesy and lots fun.

7p9lf19iSy7Q8V7UTqiICA.text: Cartel is full of coffee geniuses. They really care about their product. I've also been to the one in Tempe, where they took the time to discuss proper brewing technique. They'll give you more than you ever wanted to know: time, temperature, coffee/water ratio, etc. They even gave free samples to help us purchase beans.

6gRquZJ2r8uQ7z7CWVYLEQ.text: I especially love the 5th Avenue location in Scottsdale due to it's open windows allowing plenty of natural light in and being less crowded than Tempe. I can't actually recall ever having a bad drink here (not the case with Starbucks). The iced honey latte just enough sugar/cream to make the drink delicious but doesn't overdo it. Plus I had a significant caffeine buzz from one drink for several hours (as a caffeine addict this is also not always the case). My only caveat is I wish they opened an hour earlier so I could stop there before work!

YVyI6heKddNn9bYos4AUPA.text: Incredibly competent staff are making superb espressos using a deceptively small La Marzocco machine that produces a lip-smacking, thick-crema quality cup for us espresso addicts.   No more jonesing if you go:  So GO already !

uQOU7P8AArnm0U-Mxqsmyg.text: This place is great!  Great coffee, a nice selection of craft beer on tap and very relaxed atmosphere.  Every time I've gone I've received really good service.  If you're a fan of craft beer or coffee then you NEED to come here!

KM5Ixahu8H0V4uP9Ka5jiw.text: I swung by Cartel to grab a coffee on my lunch break a few days ago, and was impressed with the operation. It is just like how I'd imagine a coffee shop, with the vibe, kind of akward build, and character that so many coffee shops lack these days (ahem cough cough Starbuckscough!). It felt strange to be in because I am so use to the "other guys" set-up that I've been going to for years, but I liked it...it left me wanting other experiences there. The latte I had was pretty good, hand made with care and time invested, instead of just thrown together quickly by a barista in a green apron. The 2 guys behind the counter were nice, one welcoming me back for a future visit. I thought it was cool they have a side-bar where they serve a couple different micro-brews and wine, something at least I've never seen in a coffee shop. Just an interesting place all together. I wish I could've spent some more time there but I enjoyed my brief visit. As of now, they have a new customer! The coffee, unique experience, and service equals a 4.5, obviously have to down grade to a 4. Oh and a side note...their cash register is an ipad, which is something you don't see everyday.

Go7xnt-a_ykrKZpJ8UlcdQ.text: Always awesome. Quiet areas to sit and have conversations. They also serve liqueur so if that's your thing.. well have at it! It is a cool vibe that matches Tempe's cool jive. I just wish they had more cartel coffees in the East Valley..

sXfM3RRmeWTyciVzZTyoRw.text: Ordered a cortado, it was delish. Quick service, neat atmosphere. Not much else to say here other than I wish I lived closer

V0QXAJDVHGMtJrWVvFz71g.text: It's been almost a year since I've been back to this location and the only thing that's changed is the staff. The people here now are very kind and easy-going. Coffee was beautiful and delicious. Only took a few minutes to be made. Thanks for a great morning, Cartel!

-GGfQiJrC-t7gIMJkCQLDg.text: Nice atmosphere amidst a boring "Old town" that never grew past the seventies. Finally a place with Character.  You can avoid Starbucks and come straight here.  Plenty of Coffee style selections, Aeroplex, Chemex, Clever, etc.   Then there is the Craft Beer.....     However I am slightly disappointed in my Cortado.   The taste is not quite there.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good selection for Pour Overs

PcsqLahAvax0fuf7QIVBpw.text: Coffee is good (but not amazing) but the prices are crazy. An americano and a piece of banana bread should not be $8.00. What the heck???  Over $4 for an Americano. Really ?   Will say lightning fast wi fi though.

IzrV1GftmzFGAEXIi9dKsg.text: Wow such terrible service! Walked in with my in-laws to get a quick cup of coffee after a nice dinner. The barista completely ignored us for a solid 5 minutes even as we stood there ready to order $20 worth of caffeine. He clearly saw us and chose not to engage, saw us and failed to even acknowledge our presence.   I have never been completely ignored like this. We waited for 5 minutes and walked out. Not a word from the barista.  What a complete disappointment, don't waste your money.

K2qJg_7sjEeHGi00Pq4iGw.text: Overpriced. Wait time is at least 15 min for only two simple iced lattes. I like to try different coffee places other than Starbucks and I have never had an Iced Vanilla Latte taste "sour" not impressed. Would not go back.

011MnK5Vx6JVsa7Ll9keng.text: We are visiting and needed a good smooth coffee and this place was perfect. The coffee was amazing and atmosphere was great. We got the vanilla latte and it was perfect. Not too sweet and and espresso was delicious. Was pretty busy but they got our order out very fast. Highly recommend this place and it takes a lot for me to say that because I am kind of a "coffee snob"

CNEcDMQ_tr2nn9ktAY3M5A.text: Had coffee. Much smaller than their Tempe location, they have some nice beers on tap, extra seating in adjoining space. Great way to caffeine-up before walking the streets of Old-Town. Funny how people can sit there for hours nursing one cup of coffee while they stare at their PC screens. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Espresso

x8IA4d15GClN-Zbf0WW94g.text: I love Cartel.  I really do think they're amongst the best roasters in the country.  While living in Tucson, I went there 4-5 times a week, and if you have a Cartel by you, you should give them a shot.    Yes, they serve food and tea.  Drink the coffee.  They're expert coffee roasters, baristas (& dare I say...coffee snobs) and it shows in the end product.

uUSaYZOEvNhLj8viMQaz3A.text: If you care about your coffee, this is the place to go.  It absolutely doesn't get any better than this in the valley.  You really can't go wrong but their lattes are unbeatable.  Also, be sure to pick up some beans while you're there.

vflDcQqf8sYAx_CROxW4GA.text: Great coffee and great coffee selection!  They always have a few interesting coffee choices in addition to the standard coffeehouse drinks like lattes, you really can't go wrong no matter what you choose.  One day I will get a growler full of their beer, I'm sure it's awesome too!  Service is generally pretty good.  It's a small place with a few tables, nothing too comfy but nice enough.  My only real complaints with this place are:   They have items for sale all around the same place where you get lids, sugar, etc.. which is annoying if you're trying to get out of there only to try to navigate around someone looking at tea blends.    It's unclear to people who aren't regulars where to order and where to pick up, this causes unnecessary crowding in the wrong spots and general confusion.  The last time I was in there a guy was waiting at the pickup area so I walked up to place my order, he then called me out stating he actually had been there first but no one told him where to order.  I would have hoped the staff would have said something (like my bad, we should have acknowledged you) but they didn't - I allowed him to order before me but I was mortified nonetheless.  To sum up: awesome coffee, mostly good service, poor set up.

y-bPaxsna6dGIH9bGBc8Og.text: First coffee shop we tried in AZ! Gorgeous layout and super friendly people. I chose a random coffee from their list and it was surprisingly good! They also have beer tastings!

Uan199vuNFn9ZEpM6UvuKw.text: Meh.  Ordered a regular Latte and a Chai Tea Latte, both were good, I can't say that it was better than anywhere else I've tried.  However it's a really cool environment for studying or hanging out with some friends, some really good lounging areas.  The only reason I give it 3 stars was because the sizes of the drinks were REALLY tiny, like a child's size.  All in all, if I were in the area I'd probably stop by again.

yYgYucRCuOC1SfA4ZvMPSw.text: Absolute best coffee of all time. Everything the serve is high quality and made with precision. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They even put a heart on tips of my chai (which is my favorite drink there).

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chai

OVbMZuuxM7lCUlZXRVrWKg.text: 5 star coffee, 3-4 star service. I LOVE the coffee here and visit every time I'm in town. I even order their coffee online and have it shipped to Louisville KY.  The service though is just never super friendly. It's not terrible and these guys definitely know their coffee but sometimes geniuses are not the best with people.  If you're a coffee fan though you need to check it out!

QRVmEOZOAyxUWO7Pl3VlGw.text: I hate giving bad reviews, but the other reviews of this place have been nothing like my experience. Been to this location a couple times, and each time I've left disappointed. The coffee and tea are good enough, but the wifi and service have failed to impress. I've come here a couple times to get work done before a dinner plan in old town, and I've had to just quit and sit because I can't keep a steady internet connection. The staff are knowledgeable, but my interactions have consisted of lacking eye contact and as few words as possible. Lastly, the price is not competitive with similar offerings elsewhere- but as this is the only coffee shop in old town, I guess they can do what they want.

ANVq4v8cd-hrz9C8PN13CA.text: Cartel Coffee is an awesome place to hang out and relax. The atmosphere is inviting and modern. The service I received was polite and quick.  For more sophisticated coffee drinkers, Cartel has things like aeropressed coffee, but I personally went with an Americano. My drink was freshly brewed and delicious, without even a hint of bitterness.  I have quickly become a big fan of Cartel Coffee Lab and plan to be a repeat customer.

eFZrn-Wv2oX6wB4PD1-I2A.text: Really liked this cafe, had a really nice conversation with the barista. Barista is skilled and he knows what he's doing. if you're from a different country hit this place up! It's great. I am a barista in Canada so you could say it's been approved by another barista for its quality

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not the best photo but a quick snap shot of the coffee bar. Very unique atmosphere

iPN2cwdkYwY_-4LmHmcNFw.text: When visiting Scottsdale from snowy Chicago, I had iced coffee on the mind. Not just any regular iced coffee, but deep, dark, delicious cold brew. A quick search on Yelp and I found Cartel downtown. The menu is simple, and there are two sizes of cold brew. I ordered up a large for $3, and it was exactly what I was craving. It was so good, I made a return trip the next day to repeat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. simple menu
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. large cold brew

eeKhaijX2gBjktpIUZyu0w.text: Excellent coffee in Scottsdale.  Roast their own and quite well.  Enjoyed a fully washed Eithiopian Yirg which was great as a chemex.  Also serve a variety of beer and wine.  Cool decor.  Hipster but mix of folks in there the times I have been.  Espresso and lattes on a beautiful La Marzocco Strada.  Knowledgable staff.  Polite and helpful.

c-Id4mj6RbXAUekPWwEHnQ.text: Awesome Iced Coffee AKA iced Toddie (Toddy) using a cold brew process that doesn't pull the acids and bitterness out of the bean and leaves a smooth, rich and fruity cup of iced goodness. The crew formerly of Solas Coffee really provides top notch service. Snap up a chocolate chip and bacon cookie or a slice of the coffee cake that rocks. Cappuccinos and Macchiattos are for drinking in and have well crafted foam. If your looking for a super sweet 1100 calorie Fat-a-chino.. keep driving to Starbucks and sip on some burnt bean lates. Know, if you want a smooth well crafted cup drip coffee made for you or rich espresso, come see the crew at Cartel Scottsdale. They also have the OG Tempe, new downtown with kitchen and Tucson location (former ally Avenue Coffee).

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pastries sandwiches and breakfast now at cartel
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate and bacon cookie with an iced toddy.

eGjj83lHtjq1MxZT9wmXHQ.text: I don't give 5 stars often but for those of you who see my Check-in's via Yelp, you know this place is my coffee go-to!   5 reasons YOU should get your coffee on at Cartel: 1- Its local. Support your local business and PAHLEASE stop drinking corporate crap. 2- They take their coffee seriously. Have you seen the way they cold drip coffee? or how they delicately stir lattes? Yeah, get to it. 3- The vibe. LOVE the artsy interior and the fact they promote local artists by displaying their work through out the shop. 4- They have two central locations for your coffee addiction convenience. One in Tempe on University and Ash. The other on 5th avenue in Scottsdale.  5- They both offer delicious pastries and the Scottsdale location has breakfast and lunch options and just recently expanded their counter space to offer scrumptious beers.  It certainly doesn't hurt that the staff knows their stuff about coffee and that their service is courteous and real. If you don't enjoy your espresso here, you're only hurting yourself.  I love you Cartel!

Y4K4LCi8UlBSan2oRd2o1g.text: Great Espresso and everything a coffee house should be. I only tried the espresso for a quick fuel up. It was perfect and kept me going all day .

doXv2MzEhc13NcBdG1IoJQ.text: After ten years in San Francisco, I can be a bit of a coffee snob.  There's just something artistic about creating a great cup latte, espresso or coffee.  When done right, it's absolutely a wonderful taste experience.    These guys have figured it out.  More so than any other place I've tried in the Valley.  Went for the first time and ordered a 2% latte...nailed it!  Tons of flavor but very smooth at the same time.  The place is well done but; just like it's predecessor, it's the not the most comfortable place.  I wouldn't recommend for extended hours of work.

6hjGdMHkNykcWMtsv3EXUA.text: Best Cappuccino since Italy. And I drink coffee everyday! No nonsense coffee experts. They won't do cappuccino's to-go, they won't sweeten your drink, True purists. They do offer sweeteners off the register area. Amazing.

wxKvqJpWoXO0hBY87-sSJg.text: I just love everything they serve.... They have great coffee, beer, and wines, also the store's atmosphere!!! Very relaxing and I always can concentrate on my desk work there...!!!  This is the place I go even I live in Mesa!!!!

dDdGNRx20yKfy5TxWvTdnA.text: I am a frequent visitor of this place because I enjoy the positive energy and the artsy, inspirational vibes. Everytime I go I order an iced chai latte which is always prompt and DELICIOUS! I always go for seconds. There was once I received a watered down tea at the same time I got bad customer service, but I believe it was the individual that was helping me out, and I havn't seen him since. Other than that, all the pastries I've tried are delicious, their dirty chais are2 AMAZING, the location is beautiful, and the staff is friendly. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone that enjoys a little hipster coffee time fun, whether it be doing work, homework, or playing a nice game of scrabble. THIS PLACE ROCKS!!!

droJFpqQqy72-NvX-RLydQ.text: Best coffee in the Scottsdale area.   A bit pricey, and if you're looking for Starbucks-type coffee the way YOU like it, go to Starbucks. These guys won't ice your espresso because it gets bitter, and won't put your espresso in a paper cup to go. It's unlikely you can order a caramel macchiato or the other weird sugar bombs people seem to like from Starbucks or Coffee Bean Tea Leaf. But you know what?The drink that comes over that counter is REALLY GOOD.   Also, great selection of beer! Glad to know I can go somewhere on the weekend to have a latte then a beer while I work -- or maybe a couple beers, until I no longer feel like working. Plenty of space to work, excellent interior design (I believe the owner makes the really functional and comfortable industrial-modern furniture) and luckily, the crowd in the Scottsdale location turns over pretty quick, no one is sitting around for hours or needing to get kicked out by the baristas.   It's a little unclear what food they serve, there's always a couple things in the case next to the counter, have never tried any of it. Too busy trying to figure out if I want another cup of coffee or a beer.

n4ZlJKuwuU6uLQlmNi5n3Q.text: They put a lot of love into their coffee making! Hands down the best coffee! I came here and enjoyed the chai and mocha lattes each day I was in Scottsdale. I will miss my morning pick me up and friendly service now that I am back home.

x0f1077QjSq4KkLlSIctbw.text: Best place in town to get coffee. The atmosphere is so perfect. The manager Dustin is amazing as well.

N1nAJ_FcHRxSRrTbVFl-bw.text: I really wanted to like this place. It looked like it had a cool vibe from the outside so I decided to stop by and try them out one day. I probably won't come back.   The vibe is the typical, SF, Seattle hipster hangout. Being from the NW, I've been to quite a few of these types of cafes. Whether or not you're down with the whole vibe, there's one thing in common....good coffee. These guys do not know how to make good coffee. It took close to 10 minutes for the guy to make the coffee for me and it tasted like water. I expected so much more considering when I asked for soy milk in it, the guy looked at me as if I had the never to disturb the natural essence of the brown water he was about to prepare for me. He told me "he'd put it on the side'. Please...this ain't Mastros Steakhouse and I'm not asking you to put A1 steak sauce on a filet mignon. This is coffee, of which you need a little instruction on how to make. Plus..If you're going to act all "hipstery", "Seattle-ly" and try so hard to make and decorate the place like you don't care, then don't locate in Old Town Scottsdale. Also, there was a dirty kid sitting on the table right next to the water dispense having a full on conversation with a barista.. Freaking dirty yo.....

8XyBod8ahb87KJTXMmQzIQ.text: Jason Silberschlag pulls off a pretty amazing thing here in the metro-PHX area.  Three shops with their own quirky details, passion and identity.  Each tailors specifically to the demographic at hand, which I can totally get behind.  The fact that each shop has its own deal going on is awesome - I really dislike chains and the chain feel/look.  I hadn't seen Jason in a while at the other shops, the times I'd frequented, and was happy to see him behind the bar when I came here for the first time.  Just the same way the other Cartel shops have a selection of brewing methods, this one does as well.  Pour-over, aeropress, Chemex and traditional espresso (La Marz GS/3).  As expected from him, our drinks were flawless.  He transfers this knowledge and passion to the baristas, which is obvious even when one leaves his establishment to go somewhere else - they stand out in the crowd of many coffee-pullers.  The beans, who can complain?  Jason made his name with the roasting.  I got a prepared sandwich here, and my was it tasty.  Bread was fresh.  Sauce, ingredients and overall creation was good.  Big Ben: you stole my tastebuds' heart that morning.  Casual lounge area (see: couches), outdoor covered seating (see: hallway - shaded and cool!) and plenty of seating inside.  As normal, his handiwork shines throughout the shop.  Somehow I've never reviewed a Cartel shop before, despite my years of patronage.  My latest experience changes that.

cTNAnZm9bI1kWDGq-RUkxw.text: Damn nice. I like that if you order a cup of coffee they make it fresh.  I like the style of the place.  I like that the free internet works.  Basically I just like this place.

E2rdTZHxbbGgtbQFNsYy5g.text: Always perfect... friendly staff that makes you wanna hang around and chat. Wish they had some outside seating for this time of year.

WGEbD9ZmBb6EBi2lw87ZTA.text: My wife had the cappuccino and I had a local beer by Fate Brewing.  My wife drinks a lot of cappuccinos and she said this was the best she has ever had and the barista made sure every thing was done right.  This place is quality.  They also have an outside seating area.  Great coffee, beer, service, and overall ambiance. We will definitely be back.

xVjRHdDPf5ihLr3cmWpAtw.text: Smooth, Rich, Perfect.....THAT is Cartel Coffee......why get coffee that's manufactured for the masses with mythological mermaids when you could be supporting your local Cartel? wait...that sounds a little weird, but, I think you get it....  Yeah, the coffee is good (maybe I would like it a touch stronger...), I didn't get any pastries (well, there were none I could try, hence the docking of one star, i.e. vegan or dairy-free), so I can't really comment on those.....But, I will definitly be stopping in here more often, especially as my hairstylist is right around the corner (go see Emily at Revolover, she's the BEST) We actually were strolling around Old Town when the intoxicating aroma of coffee just sucked us in......mmmmmm.....it was a perfect late afternoon pick-me-up!  It's really cool inside...there are a lot of lounge style couches everywhere (in fact, my mother-in-law felt so at ease, she plopped herself on one of them and took a 10 minute power nap while we sipped our coffee, lol) Would love to come back and get a drink at the bar (best of both beverage worlds here! chose your poison, alcohol or caffeine) and would also like to give their brunch special a go......stay tuned, perhaps I'll be giving that extra star soon!

Z4fUdWNHlPfZK1rLtqqyOw.text: No doubt that the coffee was excellent- but the barista was rude and very cantankerous, despite attempts at being friendly. Not to mention the bathroom was out of toilet paper and just had a sign that said 'sorry- public bathrooms available down the street'. I wish I could give a better review since their coffee is great- but the experience was lackluster.

uBNydkNyJDTJhR908Wo_OA.text: I'm always looking for local coffee shops when I'm traveling, so it was nice to stumble (er yelp) upon Cartel when I was in Scottsdale a couple weeks ago.   I needed a coffee shop to work out of and ended up staying all day. Good wifi, great coffee, surprisingly delicious lunch, and crazy friendly staff. Definitely better than spending my day working out of Starbucks.

IMGVxXKvzPaJ19ci9gQHWg.text: Stopped in after receiving a strong recommendation from a friend. Mighty tasty coffee, great vibe, and a very friendly and informative staff. Big compliments to Bill for his exuding passion not only for coffee but also for the process and others' enjoyment of it. He went above and beyond in our discussion of different brewing processes, recommendations on grinders, and suggestions for further information. I will soon be back and it's great to see local, independent cultural drivers!

R7BeDcwxOwkkbCp1Vl9D5Q.text: Probably my favorite coffee shop in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Right in the middle of old Scottsdale. It has a cool vibe and is always busy--but not too. Excellent coffee and pastries. Comfortable seating inside and on an outdoor but covered patio. Great place to hang

g3Ci3ZPZAlY3-IDHWLOuTw.text: Boring Sunday and a sweet tooth hits so I end up at Cartel looking for cookies. They have three varieties and somehow due to miscommunication I wound up with all three varieties. The three cookies were placed in individual brown bags which all ended up looking like they contained a bag of french fries. Are cookies supposed to be that greasy to seep through the bag? The peanut butter version with peanut butter icing was below average, the cranberry/white chocolate variety was equally bad and the winner was the one that looked like an Oreo. Iced Mocha features get your own lid at this location, but not the best version in town.

fQNSw8KIOUi1l90g0ymrUw.text: Nice little local coffee shop right downtown in OldTown Scottsdale.  Easy to get to and park in the weekday morning since all the other shops haven't closed yet.  Friendly staff and decent prices.  Nice local atmosphere.  Agree with Roxy H. that it has that feel of the Aussie local coffee shops. For stay-in coffee they have mugs with a refill pricing that is nice.

J6e8GIZXUmuKoPOJD96Mhg.text: Non existent customer service but coffee is okay and decently priced, not the best ever but I like they're menu.

V-FC1RUCV3QGzNEpjeEVKA.text: I don't understand how anyone likes the coffee here. They claim to be the best. I found the coffee luke warm and weak. Now, it was so weak, that I had them put a shot of espresso in it. Nothing could bring this coffee back to life.   I am into coffee...big time. I have been drinking coffee from all over the USA since the 1970s. It has to be bold and fresh. I've been here a few times. I like the atmosphere, though it's mostly students hanging out. Still, it's pretty funky, and I wanted to love it here. the servers were nice enough. It's just that the coffee was TERRIBLE. Please, whoever owns this place, train your staff to make consistent coffee that is bold. From the three times I've been here, in different months, all three cups of your boldest coffee tasted WEAK! I don't know how to express this more. I will check you guys out again and see if there is improvement, but quite frankly, I don't see that happening. This is sad to me, because I want to love it here.

rCWIW4i268didkKfRvxd-A.text: First visit here, so  I won't be too harsh! :-)  Cute space, lots of folks with laptops and such dong research or perhaps writing the next best seller ? Friendly baristas, efficient service. Didn't see a whole lot of munchies for sale but looks like the friendly folks make scones, muffins, cookies and sandwiches too. They also sell their very own coffee! Coool!! Yippy!  I just had a large latte and it was served in a large tall glass and I thought it was pretty tasty...maybe a little more expensive than the average latte, but it was good so no complaints. I love that area of town and wish them much success.  Yep, I'm a fan because I love independent coffee houses and the folks usually work very hard to make delicious beverages and do everything they can to make the customer happy.

SjuJUu-7ExDU2pIr8b6Yqg.text: The chai was pretty good, but not my favorite since it wasn't as flavorful as it could've been. One of the employees was very nice and attentive while the other completely ignored me and was very hipster snobby. I mainly like to spend a few hours at coffee shops studying and I don't think I'll bother coming back with better options out there.

pH_U1PMj3SY8UsGpPR6zuA.text: Yay! Finding good coffee when you're an out of towner is always hit or miss and sometimes scary. Cartel was a hit. Iced agave latte was delicious. Really laid back atmosphere. Not too expensive either. Just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. UHmazing almond scone
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced agave latte

cm6rUFx8VKd2AJi3tohcag.text: Great coffee so far at the 2 locations I've visited. Hipster haven lol, better have a MacBook.

hDRJttmvgfUc8Oi8UzMf_w.text: Hipsters amaze me. Mostly because I'm the exact opposite of a hipster.   Questions that rack my brain: +How do these men get their jeans on? They're so tight!  +How long did it take to get that many tattoos?  +What kind of hair spray do hipster chicks use? +How do you decide to become a hipster? Is there a school? Or a manual at least?  I wonder if they look at me with amazement as well? Probably not, mostly because I'm not a hipster and quite ordinary when compared to a hipster.   Visiting the beautiful wood and metal adorned Cartel Coffee Lab is like watching hipsters in the wild...   (Insert British voice over and African safari noises)   Watch the hipster making coffee in their natural habitat. They are pleasant, but not overtly friendly. You look them up and down. They don't really care what you are wearing. You are fascinated... they just want to know what you want to drink? You cannot decide... the hipster is not openly bothered but most likely is annoyed by your inability to make a decision because you get nervous when hipsters stare at you. You make your decision and the hipster asks you what size. Shit, another decision must be made! Their coffee cups are small as this is not an anti-hipster corporate hangout, aka Starbucks. Wow, you think! Hipsters are so cool they don't even need a super sized venti coffee to feel important. Do you secretly want to become a hipster? No. You have no tattoos and are pretty sure that's the first requirement for being a True hipster. They do a good job with their coffee though so you shall continue to be fascinated by hipster culture from afar.   "Hipster" (as defined by Urban Dictionary:  Definitions are too mainstream. Hipster's can't be defined because then they'd fit in a category, and thus be too mainstream.  Shut the front door!  31 Yelps Challenge: #26/31

3IKY2KcmS-b4YrlwS1_wqA.text: I very much like this place and from a 3rd wave coffee lover's perspective, this is well worth a visit.   I love Cartel.  Every time i make it to Arizona, I come here.  The coffee is amazing, the staff know what is up, and the decor/feel is nice.

0gBRSg64sPo6naRJZcFxLA.text: Always great people, service, and beverages at Cartel! (Wish their chairs were more comfortable... these are hard, steel little things!). ;)

gBJ6PY3w40LG0ISDR8pEhQ.text: I had one of the best iced lattes ever at this Cartel a few weeks ago. I used to work at a coffee shop and like to consider myself a bit of a coffee connoisseur. The espresso to milk ratio was perfect with just a touch of vanilla for sweetness.   Also, I like the atmosphere. It's just some chill people getting together with their laptops and a great drink. Plus I'm a big fan of quirky seating space, which they have in abundance.

vf0FFjvfJgrr_pLLb3CHwA.text: I visited this Cartel with a group of friends one night, just before they closed.  We raced over to Old Town so we could get in the door in time, and I was pleased to see that the lone barista didn't appear disgruntled by our intrusion.  We did make it pretty easy, ordering mostly the same drink (Hot Chai Latte) and paying on one tab.  He went out of his way to help my non-coffee-drinking friend choose a tea and I overheard him joking around as he steamed some milk.  He was friendly and knowledgeable; that's what I want in a barista!  The Chai Lattes are phenomenal.  I don't know what they do differently than any other coffee shop, but they turn out great.    I like that after weaving through throngs of "Scottsdale people" (you know who I mean) I can walk in to this coffee shop and feel like I'm not in Scottsdale.  It's industrial, small, with cool decor.  I love the iPad that's used for placing orders, charging credit cards, and providing receipts.  It's sleek, eco friendly, and hip.  I hope that's the way of the future!  I also love that this isn't Starbucks.

GuaLtFRtNeEZBzI7YiyOog.text: Just discovered this place on YELP. And I can't wait to give it a try next time I'm in the area! A refreshing change from Starbucks. And the Coconut scone and Green Tea looks YUMMY!

9j_TpQ0KnUtzy5KOBq-5Ew.text: So very Portlandia in its hipsterness and decor. Premium coffee roasted in-house, in the middle of the desert, no less! Who would have thunk it.  Baristas were profesh and friendly. They even warmed up our pastries upon request. Perfectly foamed milk and fruity noted espresso. I hope this place has a long life in Scottsdale, where great coffee is few and far between.

CoWtS4xLGZBIj-LB9WhdXg.text: This is a sit-down and take-it-all in place, not unlike coffee shops to be found in places like San Francisco. if you're in a big rush and want things the way you're used to and don't like adventures, please go to Starbucks - there's one right down the street. Cartel makes each cup one at a time, so you get something truly unique. There are always many different flavors being brought in and switched out, so ask questions and make sure you get something in line with your tastes - unless you like surprises!

6e0MTjSbwXGv_qCaVcIwfg.text: I love their oolong tea, the light one. What I love the most is working on my projects here, 'cuz they have free wifi and many plugs! They have indoor and outdoor area. Great atmosphere!

F-3a3yz8rBMXfwb64AFQ1g.text: Not from Arizona and I was craving coffee decided to check this place out over the usual Starbucks and it was great! Service and ambience was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ordered the mocha latte

P4JmqoSXmiUZMfxv7mYyAQ.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent coffee and pastries. Nice and relaxing atmosphere.

s2s-VJE2gPY5MvwUEB0oDg.text: I have been to every coffee place in Scottsdale, I am not exaggerating - Literally every one. I only ever get straight black coffee. Cartel has the best. Places like Sip use Cartel Coffee but for whatever reason I like it best at Cartel. If you want the best coffee in town go to Cartel. However,  Cartel lacks friendly staff.  I am a very easy going person, not a lot of things bother me, and really the employees do not bother me all that much, but enough to write this review. I have had this conversation with many different people, and we have all agreed - the Scottsdale Cartel employees are aloof and dismissive. I am not sure if this comes from management? I know Abercrombie used to tell its employees to act aloof, so to add to its brand culture. I know that Cartel offers a premium product in terms of coffee, so it does appeal to a certain crowd. There is nothing wrong with that at all, that is why we have brands like BMW, and Prada - people like nice things.   People also like to be treated nice. I have been to a lot of coffee shops in my life, and the ones that stand out in my mind aren't always the ones with exceptional coffee (that certainly helps), but the ones that have an open, comfortable, home-like vibe. Cartel is not like that - I think it starts with the employees. I have on more than one occasion said "how are you?" or "have a nice day" only to be ignored. It is the weirdest thing.   I write this review not to criticize, but to critique. I feel somewhat alienated when I go into Cartel, it is a shame because it is close to where I live and work, and I really like the coffee, but out of principal I often avoid it.

qmWDrHOqo97yCN4ZDKBZ8g.text: Definitely my favorite Cartel location in the valley!! I've been to the one on Ash a thousand times since it's so close to campus, and while I love the look and the vibe, it's crowded pretty much all the time so there's not always seating available. I like that the old town Scottsdale location is much more relaxed and quiet, but still a nice atmosphere. The natural lighting is just wonderful, and there's a lot of extra seating in the covered area between Cartel and the building next to it. As of all Cartel locations, love the coffee and I absolutely love that they use Maya Tea! If you're a fan of chai and haven't tried it yet, it is life changing!! Best chai I've ever had, hands down.  Lots of love for the coffee, the chai, and Cartel!!

PWc0j2UOg9lh8rCF0-YbRg.text: Traveling can make you thirsty and coffee isn't a thirst quencher, but its a delicious treat . I found cartel coffee lab while driving through Scottsdale. The latte is outstanding it has an undertone of caramel. If your ever in Scottsdale treat yourself to a fantastic coffe with very eclectic people.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Latte
Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-ayfy2h2O_noBSHkzWCJsQ.text: Their espresso is meticulously prepared and served at sipping temperature. The staff chatted easily with morning regulars and engaged me as a new addition smoothly.  Sufficiently comfortable with their own offerings I was happily referred to TOCS for gluten free pastry options.  All-in-all, two Cartel coffees, one G-full pastry and a cookie from down the way.  The Cartel staff made my morning!

COukGH5DSRJ7eqxtZg67rA.text: I love local coffee shops, and this place is definitely a winner. It's got a kind of hipster feeling to it. They have an enclosed outdoor patio with plenty of tables and sitting room, as well as an inside area. The staff is very friendly.   They offer a variety of different coffees, such as Chemex, cold brew, drip, etc. I had their black coffee (which is the best way to judge a coffee shop). The roast was bold and had an excellent nutty flavor. The coffee beans were very high quality.

FORTHzOxyiaOZJyrlGdrRQ.text: Coffee was good. Greatly dislike that you walk up to a counter and order a coffee and get ready to pay and the screen flashes tip option. The lowest tip option was $1. Really? I walked up to your counter!!!!!!! You didn't bring it to a table. Will never go back to any of your coffee bars. Put a tip jar out.

aGkTzqHA22BgHeOseDK6pg.text: Trying. Way. Too. Hard.  I love my coffee and I love it most when it's within the small business community but here's where this wannabe hipster place went wrong:  1. Not enough choices for a person who knows and loves their coffee.  2. The actual coffee (wherever they say it was imported from) actually tastes like watered down mud with sprinkles of attic dust.  3. For serving sewage waste in a cup, they have the audacity to really ask a lot in price.  If you're in the area, you're better off taking a small drive down to LUX Central to get yourself something you actually might like or something at least worth paying for.

MjcDAn7YzeVYQ48FJbQuCw.text: I'm new in town and don't know many people, but one of the few peeps that I do know, informed we would be going to coffee today AND it would be at Cartel Coffee Lab.  ...You could say I didn't have a choice...but then again I didn't object either  :-)  I have stumbled into a few local coffee shops in Scottsdale and also a few chains (no shame people) Cartel definitely gives it's competitors a run for their money.   When we walked in, the smell exactly what you'd hope if you love the smell of coffee. It smelt like ~Heaven~ and by heaven I mean roasted coffee beans. People were chatting, working or simply enjoying their beverage of choice (there's even beer and wine on tap!)--it was a very welcoming and relaxing vibe.  Ok so what did I order? My girlfriend said they make a great chai so I took her word for it but took it a step further...I ordered me a *dirty*chai (chai with a shot of espresso). and It was Perfect. If you love chai you know how important it is for it to not be too sweet and this had the perfect combo of spice, hint of espresso and creaminess!  It's sad to admit how much I loved Cartel Coffee Lab's brew and have to accept that it's out of the way to get on a regular basis but when I'm in the neighborhood I will definitely be stopping in to get my fix!  *cheers*

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Local art

fP3lY1oQ2HwarOlbVbsYFA.text: I adore their pour over selection and their cold brew is to die for. There is ample space to relax and enjoy your coffee. Favorite unwind after work.

lwuqKvAYsVTXqMlVL9FFUA.text: Came in for a cup of coffee and was greeted immediately by the baristas. Not knowing what I was in the mood for, other than caffeine, they made a recommendation and I ended up with a hot Chai Tea. They also offered a few tastings of their brews. I def will be back to try more coffee and touch down for a few hours. The place has a good vibe and lots of seating for reading or working.

pz6RJ1Rn4BFyj1xoSS2Oaw.text: The best.   Best coffee in Scottsdale hands down. Very similar to Portola in OC.  Friendly staff.

REiTxA5T6G7RnFUQBdOMPQ.text: The mocha here is delicious! It was one of the best mochas I've ever had. It wasn't overly chocolatey & it had a unique aftertaste. I also tried the cold brew & aero pressed coffee (with Maravilla coffee from Guatemala). Both were very good. The shop's unique because there's a side outdoor area with seats and lounge furniture & also a backroom where people predominantly study. I like the segregation of the dining spaces because it allows for people who want to talk be separated from people who want to read/study. A bag of beans here costs around $19. They serve pour over and chemex coffee as well. They also seem to serve some alcohol.

WJ4YXeAr-yrAYEEjJkWwRA.text: Definitely a very good craft coffee roaster. I enjoyed their Colombian single origin espresso and pour over. Great washed coffee with very buttery notes and a sweet, clean finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Egb0scwb4BWj825VrXkvnw.text: OMG, I love this little coffee shop!  I went there three times over the course of a couple of days while visiting Scottsdale. Unique coffees - I had a latte with agave in it. You don't get stuff like that at Starbucks!  wish we had one of these in Chicago burbs.

VYIYkIenU753cUgTpSZXUQ.text: Best cold brew I've ever had.. and I've had a lot. Staff was really friendly. Loved the atmosphere too.

Vggympay4yFY_jVYj5bBpg.text: Great location, right smack dab downtown (rather old town) Scottsdale, but where is everyone? Isn't this a touristy spot? It is like a ghost town on a Sunday morning in mid-July. It is also 10 degrees cooler (down to mid 90s) this morning, so I am definitely having a HOT latte.   The good news? No problem finding parking and no waiting in line to order either.   Smooth espresso in my latte, but I certainly did not need a 16 ounce (served in a gigantic glass). A 12 ounce in a cup would have been sufficient for my needs.   Pretty cool art for sale on one of the walls.   Loved the location.

EizlXrlLmx2RmXO0pdkbDg.text: Amazing cappuccino.  Truly awesome.  Free wifi and a place in the back to work.  All good.  Prices as unreasonable as any other coffee shop.  The bad:  Sloooow service.  We were made to feel like an inconvenience.  This is Old Town, not Beverly Hills.  Weird vibe.  Surreal and silent.  Kind of a cold feeling place with no one smiling or laughing.  I felt like we crashed a funeral.    I will go back for a coffee to go.

57tVw9kjNUMV1vuPxEDH8g.text: Cartel is one of Arizona standards as far as specialty coffee goes! One of my favorite parts about cartel is the fact that every location has a different vibe.  This one is definitely the most chill of all of the cartels. This is where I come alone to do homework or I come with one other person to have great conversation.   The staff is solid and all of the baristas know what they are talking about.  I come here pretty often because I know cartel is consistent across the board.   BB's Rating: THANK YA JESUS FOR CAFFEINE

5Zo-NBh-6E0J6_fg5KCV-A.text: The earthiest, most delicious late that I ever had and repeatedly have at this coffee place. And then, there are at least three different rooms/areas  that anyone can sit and enjoy their coffee. Highly recommend!

t6isrWR-EDMRRy-8l3sGsw.text: I love the coffee here. Heads up Mocha-frappa-latte-cino drinkers, this is a Coffee Bar, not a cafe. Don't come expecting to get your double whip triple shot low fat salted caramel gargle blaster here.   The service was friendly, the air conditioning was just-right, there's plenty of 20amp power jacks, and the wifi works as promised.   My only complaint is that the furniture is very noisy on the concrete flooring. I had to move a coffee table and it sounded like nails on a chalkboard.   Seriously, get some soft feet on those metal table legs!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Day drinking is cool.

35hY8spuTn3ZjC91B5Bi5w.text: I came in 4/28 at 10AM and I am disgusted by how incredibly rude the staff was. The girl in the front taking my order was horrendous. I literally was so turned off of the service that after I got my beverage, which by the way the girl in the front never wrote to use almond milk (I have a dairy allergy), thank goodness I caught that before consuming it, I got the right one but just tossed it when I walked out. The vibe, the energy, the horrible customer service and rude girl in the front killed this coffee shop for me. I will NEVER return.

PRC0K1dbTpdHtKe-1hDh7g.text: Delicious! Really impressed with their iced latte. Cute place too if you wanted to hang out for a bit!

4kvbzrmhfzhI48KEAiXNmQ.text: Best cold brew in town. Great atmosphere. Barista guy could have been friendlier when I asked for a straw but I'd definitely come back.

iUMpU2BWqch_02M6u0bYYw.text: Had a dirty chai latte. It was expensive as heck, but it was so good I sometimes find myself craving another one.   But I don't live in Arizona, so I guess I'll have to keep dreaming.   The atmosphere in this place is chill, and kind of inspiring I feel like it's the type of place where I would have some serious epiphanies.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K76n5MAxKE3YqUmOo4-8mw.text: This is Arizona's best coffee shop. From the perfect pour to the great employees working there just a great vibe. Don't forget the tasty treats.  Hunter Pence favorite place to stop

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xFPGe4ccDmhyEYEvu1pE3A.text: This location is preferred to their Tempe and DTPHX locations! I love how it's located in Old Town, where you are walking distance to a variety of shops and restaurants.  I always get the lattes here (iced or hot) and found them to be pulled well. Though I did have a hot latte once served in a beer glass and that was not so nice ... for my unassuming hand. Hot coffee and glass = bad idea. However, I got over that with a little sleeve and having my coffee cooled down a bit. Good coffee here and love the buzz even from their latte.  The interior is very industrial with tons of metal, wood and raw looking. I found the sound to be quite minimal even with such a small space encasing a few number of people. There's seating out front, on their covered porch area (which can be quite warm) and have a quieter back room near the bathrooms that's separated by a door. Music is played at a low volume which isn't too distracting, but enough to break the silence.  Great place to have a chat over good coffee or to work on your computer.

photos.caption: Photo of Cartel Coffee Lab - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Large Skim Latte
